loans.name: Philimena

texts.en:
Philimena ,43, lives in Buchanan. She is hard-working. Her husband is a teacher. Philimena is a mother of  five loving children between the ages of 7 and 25. They live at home and are in school. 

Philimena  has been selling fashion clothes, chains, earrings, watches, and slippers for the past fourteen years. She started this business with the initial capital that she saved from a saving club. 

Philimena learned to sell from her friends. She sells twelve hours per day. She purchases her goods from wholesale dealers and transports it by commercial vehicle.

Philimena is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion clothes (e.g., blouses, dresses), chains, earrings, and many others items for the business. Her plan for the future is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes (e.g., blouses, dresses), chains, earrings, and many others items for the business.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 27 years old, married and a mother of one child. For the last two years, Asia has earned a living by selling clothes in Malindi, making a monthly profit of KES 17,750. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for her first loan of KES. 30,000, to buy additional stocks of dresses, blouses, trousers, and shirts to sell to her customers.

Asia will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her children's school fees as well as expand her business. Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she can help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dresses, blouses, trousers, and shirts.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice, 38 years old, is married and has one child. She sells clothing materials and new clothes in Malindi, earning a monthly income of about KES 6,500. 

Beatrice was introduced to KADET LTD by a staff member. She has applied for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy more clothes to sell. Beatrice intends to continue growing her business and hopes that one day she will come to own a well established boutique in the area.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
La señora Paula, tiene 57 años de edad, casada, tiene 5 hijos pero solamente vive con uno de ellos, los demás son independientes, ella vive en Taulabe, Comayagua.
Hace 35 años que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de variedad de comidas, vende almuerzos, golosinas como baleadas, tacos, pollo frito con tajadas etc. el negocio lo tiene establecido en un local que alquila y en un lugar estratégico de venta. Ya cuenta con buena clientela. El préstamo que solicita es por 15,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de insumos como carnes, arroz, vegetales, verduras, frijoles, manteca, condimentos y otros ingredientes que necesita para la elaboración de comidas y así podrá mantener su negocio activo y con mayor volumen de ventas. Su meta es trabajar duro para superarse y asegurar su futuro.
texts.en:
Sra. Paula is 57 years old, married, and has five children. Only one child lives with her since the others are independent. Paula lives in Taulabe, Comayagua.

For the past 35 years, Paula has been preparing and selling a variety of dishes. She sells breakfast foods and snacks such as “baleadas” (Honduran stuffed tortillas), tacos, fried chicken with plantains, and other dishes. Her business is set up in a rented shop and is located in a strategic sales area. She already has a good clientele.

The loan she is requesting is in the amount of 15,000 HNL and will be invested in the purchase of supplies such as meat, rice, vegetables, beans, lard, condiments, and other ingredients needed to prepare her dishes. This will allow her to maintain an active business and to generate more sales. Her goal is to work hard so that she can succeed and secure her future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 24 years old. For the past four years, he has earned a living by offering point-to-point transport services in Malindi town, from which he earns a monthly profit of KES 8,000. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for his second loan, in the amount of KES 40,000. He is going to use a portion of the loan to service and repair his motorbike and use the remaining amount to put up a fruit and vegetable kiosk for his sister to run.

He will use the profits to invest back into his business. His goal for the future is to continue growing his businesses, so that he would improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to service and repair his motorbike, and to put up a fruit and vegetable kiosk.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge, in the Fortportal region of Uganda. For the past one year, Betty has been working hard to manage her small business, selling dried foods. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more dried foods, such as beans and maize flour, to resell, and will help Betty to generate greater profits and improve her stardand of living. Betty hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own. 

Betty is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more dried foods, such as beans and maize flour, to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase Tiendatek software to better manage his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a wooden roof over the front part of his house.

loans.name: Manuel Mesías

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre soltero de 31 años que vive con su padre en la parroquia "Luz de América" de "Santo Domingo" que es una de las ciudades más jóvenes del Ecuador, actualmente se ha constituido en el punto de enlace entre las región Sierra y Costa del país. Es un sitio privilegiado, no solo por la riqueza étnica, sino también por los paisajes inusitados que se pueden encontrar desde el ingreso mismo a esta bella ciudad. Santo Domingo de los Colorados pertenece actualmente a la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, recientemente conformada.  La fiesta principal de Santo Domingo, se celebra con un movimiento intenso de visitantes, intercambio comercial y cultural. Una gran feria tiene lugar en las instalaciones de la Asociación de Ganaderos, allí se muestran y compiten los mejores ejemplares de las distintas razas y cruces que son criados en las haciendas de la región. 

Manuel se dedica junto a su padre a la agricultura desde hace 15 años y esta actividad es el sustento de su hogar. Le ha ido bien, ya que gracias a esto ha podido llevar una vida modesta. Aprendió esta actividad de su familia ya que provienen de una cultura étnica en la cual el trabajo principal que se realiza es la agricultura. Manuel necesita comprar abono para lo cual requiere un préstamo que le ayudará a adquirir este producto y algunos insumos adicionales para cuidar de manera correcta su producción y evitar pérdidas. 

Manuel sueña con un día poder construir su casa propia y su automóvil. También quisiera encontrar una mujer con la que pueda tener una buena familia. Y esta es su meta de vida y a la que considera más importante que su meta económica. El está agradecido con Fundación Alternativa que apoya al sector rural y que cree en los emprendedores que desean crecer en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Manuel is 31 years old. He is single and lives with his father in the "Luz de America" parish in Santo Domingo - one of the newest towns in Ecuador; it  was built where the mountainous and coastal regions of the country meet. It is a very special place, non only because of its rich ethnic diversity, but also because of the unusual landscapes one can find from the moment one enters this beautiful town. Santo Domingo de los Colorados is part of the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, which has only recently ben formed.
Santo Domingo's main fair attracts many visitors and allows for cultural and commercial exchanges. The fair takes place at the Ranchers' Association's facilities, where the best examples of a variety of breeds and crossbreeds raised by the region's ranchers compete. Manuel and his father have been working in farming for 15 years and this activity is their livelihood. Manuel has done well which has allowed him to lead a modest life. He learnt to work in farming from his family, who comes from an ethnic culture where farming is the main source of work. Manuel needs a loan to purchase fertilizer as well as other supplies so he can take care of his crops and avoid losses. He dreams that one day he may be able to build his own house and car. He would also like to meet a woman with whom he could start a good family. And this is his life's goal, which he believes to be more important than his economic goal. He is grateful to Fundacion Alternativa who helps those in the rural sector and believes in entrepreneurs who want to grow their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for crops and to improve production

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 40 years old and is married to Catherine. They have two children aged 11 and 6. Richard has been doing commercial farming for about 13 years and earns an income of approximately KES 20,000.

He has applied for his second loan of KES 35,000 from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous loan. He will use the loan amount to buy farm inputs for his farm.

He hopes to increase the size of his farm to get more profit, which will enable him to provide quality education for his children.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs for his farm.

loans.name: Emilly's Group

texts.en:
Emilly's group is comprised of six hard-working women. Emilly is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge, in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, who are currently in school. For the past five years, Emilly has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells essential commodities, like milk, sugar, salt and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Emilly has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase her inventory of essential commodities for sale. This will help Emilly to generate greater profits and pay some school expenses, such as books and pencils. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to build her own house. 

Emilly is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities, like milk, sugar and salt, to resell in her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert is an energetic young man aged 25 residing in Nyamitanga, a suburb in Mbarara municipality, western Uganda. He is a former street kid who does not know his parents but out of his hard work he managed to get a well wisher who trained him in motorcycle mechanics and repairs. He has managed to earn a living and survive.

He now operates a mini mechanical workshop repairing the old motorcycles used by the poor people to survive. He has a challenge of a lack of spare parts, so he is requesting a loan of 800,000 UGX to purchase spare parts to help him with the repairs of such motorcycles so that he can boost his business as well as improving the standard of living for him and his customers.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Mujeres Organizadas Group

texts.es:
Este trabajador grupo esta es su quinto ciclo, gracias a que todas se ayudan lo están logrando. El trabajo para ellas es un medio de lograr lo que quieren y a la vez ayudar a sus familias.
La mayoría de las integrantes se dedican a la cría y faena de animales y la Señora Higinia es un ejemplo de Mujer Emprendedora que anteriormente no tenia animales y con el crédito de otros ciclos está comprando de a poquito y en la actualidad tiene muchísimos animales para faenar y vender. Gracias a la ayuda de su grupo y a su trabajo está saliendo adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, para poder tenerlos bien y que nos les falte su alimento.
texts.en:
This hardworking group is in its fifth cycle, thanks to the fact that all of the members help one another.  For them, work is a way to achieve what they want and help their families at the same time.

Most of the members raise animals and Higinia is an example of an enterprising woman who did not used to have animals and got them with loans from previous cycles.  She is buying them little by little and now has many to sell.  Thanks to the group’s help and her work, she is getting ahead.

She is asking for this loan because she wants to buy balanced feed for her animals so that she can keep them healthy and well fed.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Actualmente  el comité Kuña Katupyry  se encuentra en la etapa 7º  ciclo con 14 integrantes. Todas las integrantes se dedican en invertir en sus actividades y hacer crecer sus negocios con su trabajo.
La Sra. Aureliana es parte de este grupo, y cuenta ella que se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo, y que gracias a esto tiene los ingresos para ayudar a su familia. Aureliana tiene muy buenas manos para los comestibles, y es por eso que le va muy bien.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de carne, condimentos, verduras y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas y dando así también a su familia lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Currently the “Kuña Katupyry” group is in its seventh cycle and has 14 members.  All members do different things and want to grow their businesses.

Aureliana is part of the group and sells typical food dishes.  Thanks to this, she has an income to help her family.  Aureliana has a good touch for food, so things are going well for her.

She is asking for a loan to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, and other ingredients to make her food and providing for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
Genaro es un señor de 46 años, está acompañado hace más de 15 años y no tiene hijos. Hace 12 años empezó con una pequeña despensa en su casa, donde su esposa atendía mientras él se dedicaba a comprar animales para faenarlos y luego vender la carne en la despensa.
Actualmente se encuentra trabajando toda la familia  en la despensa, ya que es el centro de compras más importante y concurrido de la ciudad. Gracias al trabajado arduo de Don Genaro y su esposa están creciendo y les va bien. La meta que tiene es poder seguir agradando su negocio y seguir siendo el principal centro de compras de la ciudad.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de productos para su despensa, como ser: bebidas y artículos de primera necesidad como:   harina, yerba, fideos y arroz en cantidad.
texts.en:
Genaro is 46 years old and has been married for 15 years.  He doesn’t have children.  Twelve years ago he started a small grocery store in his home, where his wife tends customers while he raises animals then sells the meat in his store

At the moment, the whole family works in the store.  It’s located in the most important and travelled part of the city.  The business is growing, thanks to Gernaro’s and his wife’s hard work.  His goal is to be able to continue growing his business and being the center of shopping in the city. 

She is asking for this loan to buy foodstuffs such as drinks and primary needs products like flour, herbs, noodles, and rice in quantity.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Domiciano

texts.es:
El Sr. Domiciano, tiene 52 años, está casado con la Sra.  Lucia, hace ya 28 años, y tienen 3 hijos, todos ya mayores que trabajan.
En un principio, el había venido de la ciudad  Isla Pucú del  interior del país allí trabajaba en el campo junto a sus padres, pero luego vino a Villa Elisa y trabajó con su esposa en un pequeño taller de costura, donde contaba con 2 máquinas y más adelante fue adquiriendo otras máquinas, que le ayudo  a conseguir más  trabajos y contactar con otras clientelas.
El está muy contento porque en su taller trabajan todos sus hijos de esa manera también se siente apoyado por su familia, hoy día su esposa está trabajando en el exterior del país y desde ahí les ayuda.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de una maquina doble aguja, la cual le ayudara a seguir trabajando y también dar ayuda a otras personas.
texts.en:
Domiciano is 52 years old and has been married to Lucia for 28 years.  They have three adult children who work.

He came from the city of Isla Pucú, in the center of the country, where he used to work in the fields with his parents, but he later came to Villa Elisa and worked with his wife in a small sewing workshop, where he had two sewing machines.  Later he began acquiring other machines that helped him get more jobs and more customers.

He is very happy because all of his children work in his workshop so he also feels supported by his family.  His wife is currently working outside the country and helps him from there.

He is asking for this loan so he can buy a double stitch sewing machine which will help him work and help others.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Anh would like a new loan to buy additional nutrition supplements to sell from her store. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy additional nutrition supplements to sell from her store.

loans.name: Lieu

texts.en:
Lieu is requesting a new loan to buy a range of products, such as sugar, cooking oils and sauces, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.
She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of products, such as sugar, cooking oils and sauces, to restock her general store

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en: Thanh is requesting a new loan to buy more good-quality rice for her production of vermicelli and to buy a greater quantity of boxes for packaging. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more good-quality rice to produce vermicelli, and to buy a greater quantity of boxes for packaging.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new beverages, to restock her food stall. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new beverages

loans.name: Kuña Mbarete Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Kuña Mbarete, está en su ciclo numero 4. Kuña mbarete quiere decir mujer fuerte, y eso es lo que son, 19 mujeres fuertes, trabajadoras y por sobre todo con mucho entusiasmo para crecer y salir adelante.
La presidenta de este grupo se llama Mirian, y ella se dedica a la peluquería, tiene un pequeño salón en el que atiende a todos sus clientes. El gran deseo de Mirian es poder tener un gran salón de belleza para poder atender a más clientes y también poder dar trabajo a otras personas que quieren salir adelante.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de tintes, spray, gel,  shampoo, enjuagues y demás insumos para poder seguir creciendo y dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group of women called “Kuña Mbarete” is in its fourth cycle.  Kuña Mbarete means “Strong Woman” and is made up of 19 hardworking strong women with a great enthusiasm to grow and get ahead.

Mirian is the group’s president and a hair stylist.  She has a small salon where she serves all of her customers.  Her greatest desire is to have a great salon where she can serve more customers and be able to provide jobs for others who want to get ahead.

She is asking for this loan to buy tints, spray, gel, shampoo, rinses, and other supplies so that she can continue growing and providing good service.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 2 Group

texts.es:
Mujeres unidas 2 tiene por nombre este grupo de Ciudad del Este, tiene 20 integrantes, y gracias al trabajo que todas ellas hacen están ya en su ciclo numero 17. Están saliendo adelante y trabajan todas juntas para ayudarse.
Nilda es miembro de este grupo, ella vende perfumes y fragancias de todas marcas, y para hombres y mujeres. Es muy buena vendedora ya que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, que siempre le hace pedidos y de esa forma se va ganando la vida por medio de su trabajo.
Nilda tiene la esperanza de seguir trabajando con su grupo y así seguir creciendo y ayudando a su familia. Solicita el crédito para la compra de perfumes, pues quiere tener más variedad para poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group, “Mujeres Unidas 2” is from the City of Este and is made up of 20 members.  Thanks to the work that they all do, they are in their 17th cycle.  They are getting ahead and all help one another. 

Nilda is a member of this group and sells perfumes and fragrances of all brands for men and women.  She is a good saleswoman, has won many customers who always request things from her, and she earns a living in this way. 

Nilda hopes to continue working with this group, and continue growing and helping her family.  She is asking for this loan to buy perfumes.  She wants to have a variety on hand to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy perfumes.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 52 years old, married, and has four grown children and two minors. She lives in Garcia-Hernandez, Bohol. She has been engaged in farming together with her husband and children for two years now. She earns 2,000 PHP monthly. This is her main source of her income from which they get their daily needs.

Josefina is requesting a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizers and vegetable medicine. Through this loan, she will be able to plant more crops in her farm and will be able to harvest good and healthy crops and vegetables during harvesting time.

In the future, she dreams of expanding her business and to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizers and vegetable medicine.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en: Minh is requesting a new loan to buy new tools and accessories, such as a hair dryer, razors, and chairs. Minh's previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in attracting new customers. He also hopes that through the loan, he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new tools and accessories, such as a hair dryer, razors, and chairs

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim is requesting a new loan to buy a range of beverages, to restock her stall. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy many kinds of beverages to provide to her customers.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en: Hien is requesting a new loan to buy hairdressing equipment and related supplies, and cosmetics, so she will be equipped to provide her customers with good-quality services. Hien's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her to attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and supplies, such as shampoo, dye, and nail polish

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité “La Esperanza” se encuentra en el Séptimo Ciclo con 17 integrantes. Cada una con sus respectivas actividades, donde todas ellas son muy unidas responsables y solidarias entre ellas.
La presidenta del comité es la Sra. Nilda, quien se dedica a la venta de ropas en su barrio, es una persona muy humilde, responsable, activa y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Gracias a las ventas que hace está ayudando a su familia y se está haciendo conocida a otros clientes.
Nilda Solicita de este crédito para la compra de ropas de todos tipos, ya que se acerca la época de navidad y año nuevo y es cuando más clientela tiene, y quiere poder estar preparada.
Este grupo desea seguir trabajando con la fundación ya que las ha ayudado mucho y gracias a las capacitaciones están saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
The “La Esperanza” group is in its seventh cycle and is made up of 17 members.  Each has her own business and all of them are united, responsible, and mutually supported.

Nilda is the group’s president and also sells clothing in her neighborhood.  She is a very humble, responsible, active person with a great desire to get ahead.  Thanks to her sales, she is helping her family and becoming known to other customers.

Nilda is asking for this loan to buy clothing of all types, now that the Christmas and New Year season is coming.  This is when she has the most customers and she wants to be prepared. 

This group wants to continue working with the foundation because it has helped them greatly and the training has helped them to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Lang

texts.en: Lang is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her to increase the size of her store and grow her sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to resell in her store

loans.name: Gai

texts.en: Gai is requesting a new loan to buy good-quality food to sell. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her to increase the size of her food stall and grow her sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy good-quality food to sell from her stall

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van 35, is married and has one son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living working as a worker in a local company. Van supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She started this business six years ago. She sells snack foods, shampoo and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan in order to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular food and household items, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living condition and set aside some money to face future difficulties.

loans.use: purchase a greater variety of products, in particular food and household items.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is a 34-year-old, married woman, who lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has one daughter. Lan and her husband support their family by running a general store and selling clothing, which they have done for two years. 

Lan would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and soft drinks, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that, through the loan, her business will generate a higher income, helping her to improve her family's living conditions, and enabling her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and soft drinks, to resell in her store

loans.name: Lam

texts.en:
Lam is 34 years old and is married. He lives with his wife and one child, in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife earns a living by making cloth.

Lam earns an income to support his family, by running a business of producing metal products and parts. Lam intends to use his loan to expand his business and increase his productive capacity, by buying a lathe. 

Lam hopes that his business will run smoothly, and that the increase in income he expects will be realized. This would help him to improve his family's living conditions and to save money for his child's education.

loans.use: to buy a lathe to produce metal products, which will increase his productive capacity.

loans.name: Xuyen

texts.en: Xuyen is a 41-year-old married woman. She has two children and lives with them in Ho Chi Minh City. For two years she has operated an internet shop to serve people in her community. Xuyen would like a loan to maintain and upgrade her computers and also invest in a general store by buying goods such as snack foods to stock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her computers and buy basic goods, such as snack foods, to stock her general store.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan, 44, is married and has two sons. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income working as a buidling worker. Lan supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She started this business two years ago. She sells snacks, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular food and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living condition and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products, in particular food and beverages, to stock her store.

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en: Quyen, a 53 year-old married woman, lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have supported their family for the past two years by running a business of producing bags and packaging. Quyen plans to use this loan to buy materials for making a greater quantity of bags and packaging. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy materials for producing bags and packaging.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien, 29 years old, is married and has two daughters. Her husband is a worker in a local factory. She  supports her family through the income she earns from her general store from which she sells cosmetics and common household products. She has run this business for 13 years. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hien intends to take a loan to buy a greater quantity of cosmetic products and household items to sell from her general store to meet her customers' demands. She hopes that the additional products will enable her to increase her sales. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and household items to sell from her general store.

loans.name: Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
Pyapy mbarete quiere decir brazo fuerte, el cual lo tienen estas 14 mujeres de este grupo, ya que son muy trabajadoras y luchan por sus familias y sus hijos, ya que quieren que tengan un futuro lleno de oportunidades que ellas no pudieron tener.
Presentación, la presidenta de este grupo se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, y cuenta que muchas clientas siempre le hacen pedidos, ya que sus cosméticos son muy buenos y no son caros, y así se hace de fama y atrae a nuevas clientas. Presentación es una persona muy capaz y trabajadora, que se esfuerza mucho por su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de cosméticos, pues quiere tener buena variedad para poder ofrecer a sus clientas. El grupo agradece por la ayuda que recibe, pues les permite a la vez ayudar a sus familias.
texts.en:
“Pyapy mbarete” means “strong arm” and is made up of 14 women.  They are all hardworking and work hard for their families so that their children will have a future full of opportunities that they themselves did not have.

Presentación is the group’s president, sells cosmetics, and has many steady customers who order from her because her cosmetics are of good quality and are not expensive.  This is how she becomes known and attracts new customers.  Presentación is a very capable and hardworking woman who makes a great effort for her family.

She is asking for this loan to buy cosmetics because she wants to have a good variety to be able to offer to her customers.  The group is grateful for the assistance because it helps them to help their families.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung is 48 years old and married with five children, four sons and one daughter. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She runs a general store to earn an income and raise her children. She started her business ten years ago. 

Nhung intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of different beverages, shampoos, and sanitation items to stock her store and sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy beverages, shampoo and sanitation items to sell from her general store

loans.name: Hoai

texts.en:
Hoai, 43, is married and has a son. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. Hoai and his wife have been running a general store in front of their house for fourteen years. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying more different products such as candies, toys for kids and sanitation items to better satisfy his customers.

He hopes his business will run smoothly and generate a higher income. This will assist him in improving his family's living conditions and sending his child to school.

loans.use: To buy candies, toys for kids and sanitation items to sell at his store.

loans.name: Primero De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
Este grupo nace gracias a la iniciativa de unas de las miembros, quien queriendo ayudar a sus amigas y vecinas del barrio les contó del programa de mujeres de la fundación paraguaya, y es así que se juntaron 25 mujeres, que hoy en día es un comité muy trabajador, y que esta sabiendo pasar todo lo que se les presenta.
La sra. Gladys, una miembro, tiene una despensa bien surtida, en la que trabaja desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, hasta muy tarde en la noche. Su negocio la ayuda a dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan, y también cubre los gastos del día a día. Su meta es poder ampliar su despensa para poder tener mejor lugar para atender a sus clientes.
Gladys pide esta ayuda para poder invertirlo en la compra de los productos que mas se venden, como ser: verduras, leche, pan, carne y otros, ya que teniendo esto se asegura la clientela que tiene.
texts.en:
This group was born out of the initiative of some of the members, who wanted to help their friends and neighbors, so they spoke to them about the “Fundación Paraguaya” program for women.  25 ladies got together and now have a hard working group that can meet any challenge.

Gladys is one of the group’s members and has a well-stocked grocery store, where she works from early morning to late evening.  Her business helps her to provide everything that her family needs and also covers the day to day expenses.  Her goals are to expand her store and be able to serve more customers.

Gladys is asking for this loan to buy the products that she sells most, such as vegetables, milk, bread, meat, and other things to be able to meet her customers’ demands.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la Fundación,  el grupo se encuentra en el 6º ciclo, y gracias a las capacitaciones que tiene las mujeres se esfuerzan y quieren seguir creciendo dentro del programa.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Irma, ella tiene 2 hijos  está casada  con el Sr. Jorge. Ella se dedica hace varios años a la cría de pollos y productos Agropecuarios. Cuenta la Sra. Irma que el crédito que solicita, lo quiere usar para la compra de insumos agropecuarios para poder tener una mejor variedad para sus clientes.
Irma cometa que al igual que ella, las demás miembros del grupo ponen todo de sí para crecer y aprender, ya que gracias a esto están ayudando a sus familias
texts.en:
This group from the city of Encarnación came about through one of the members contacting the Foundation. The group is in its sixth loan cycle, and thanks to the training the women have, they do their best and want to keep growing in the program. 

One of the group members is Irma. She is married to Jorge and has two children. For several years she has raised chickens and sold agricultural supplies. Irma says that she wants to use the loan she is requesting to buy agricultural supplies. This will enable her to have a better variety for her customers.

Irma comments that like her, the other members of the group put all of themselves into their businesses, so that they can grow and learn. Thanks to this they are helping their families.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies to sell.

loans.name: Khanh

texts.en:
Khanh, 58, is married and has eight children: three sons and five daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a storekeeper of a supper market. She earns an income running a general store in front of their house. 

She started this business ten years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular food and beverages, in order to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business will run smoothly and generate a higher income. This will assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly is 48 years old and married. She has been selling fish at a small market for two years. She started this business to cover her expenses, and to raise her two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Ly is requesting a loan to expand her business by offering more kinds of fish. Thus she will be able to increase the inventory turnover of her business.

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish for selling

loans.name: Can

texts.en:
Can is a 42-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and three sons in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a security guard. For 15 years, she has run a gym for the people in her community.

Can would like a loan to purchase better quality gym equipment. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase better quality gym equipment.

loans.name: Dao

texts.en:
Dao is 55 years old and is widowed. She has five children and lives with them in Ho Chi Minh City.

She has earned money by planting bean sprouts at her house for 14 years. She intends to use her loan to increase her working capital to buy planting tools and good quality green beans to make better bean sprouts to sell.

She hope her business will continue to run smoothly. This will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to buy planting tools and good quality green beans to make better bean sprouts to sell.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa, 33, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a driver for hire. Hoa has run a flower shop for ten years.

Hoa is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of flowers to sell at her store. This will enable her to better satisfy her customers during coming holiday seasons. She hopes her business continues to run smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of flowers to sell at her store.

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en:
Huyen is 30 years old and married with two children, a son and a daughter. Her husband is a worker in a local company. Huyen has been running a general store in front of her door for over ten years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Huyen is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase turnover in her business. She hopes that with this loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité Maria Auxiliadora es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  las integrantes del comité se fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal. Son reconocidas en su barrio como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
La Sra. Maria, presidenta del grupo,  está casada, y tiene 3 hijos, es muy emprendedora e innovadora, y cuenta que se dedica a la costura. Empezó con muy pocos clientes, pero después, y gracias al buen trabajo que hace, hoy en día ya tiene mucha clientela. Maria dice que todo el esfuerzo que hace es por sus hijos, ya que quiere que sean personas de bien, útiles a la sociedad.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder seguir invirtiendo en su trabajo, ya que es su modo de ayudar a su familia, y quiere comprar telas para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Maria Auxiliadora” group is from the City of San Lorenzo and the members’ main objective is for each of them to grow, both professionally and personally.  They are known in the neighborhood for being hardworking.

Maria is the group’s president.  She’s married, has three children, and it very enterprising and innovative.  She has a sewing business and started it with a few customers, but now she has many customers, thanks to her quality work.  Maria says that all of her effort is for her children, who she wants to see become professionals and productive member of society.

She is asking for this loan so that she can invest in her business.  This is her way of helping her family and she wants to buy fabric so that she can meet her customer demand.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen would like to take a further loan to buy animal feed and pay school fees of her children. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

Yen hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her young dairy cows and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majeda, 48 years old, is a mother of one daughter and one son. She has an embroidery business that is helping in supporting the family along with her husband's retirement salary. 

Majeda has now applied for this loan in order to buy more fabric and special threads to make more embroidered pillows and potentially start making embroidered dresses.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and special threads

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang would like to take a further loan to pay for her children's school fees. Her previous loan enabled her to earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in paying for the education of her children without having to withdraw capital from her business. She also hopes that through the loan she can maintain her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao would like to take a further loan to buy more cows and animal feed, and to pay the school fees of her children. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

Thao hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more cows and animal feed, and to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong would like to take a further loan to buy cattle and pay school fees for her children. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and
increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy cattle and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is 25 years old and married. She and her husband have been running a business sewing clothes and other products for two years. She started this business to cover her expenses and raise her daughter. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Loan is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying sewing materials to increase her production of clothing. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials to make clothing

loans.name: Thach

texts.en:
Thach is a 54-year-old married woman. She lives with three children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money by repairing scooters and driving for hire. For two years, Thach has helped her husband to repair scooters and also run a general store selling milk, beverages, stationery, and confections.

Thach intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of products to sell from her store such as eggs, sugar, sanitation items. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To buy eggs, sugar, and sanitation items to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Futuro Group

texts.es:
12 son las mujeres que forman este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación, son amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, y se unieron ya que vieron una gran oportunidad para progresar y ayudar a sus familias. Están ya en el cuarto ciclo, pero quieren seguir creciendo.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Edita, ella trabaja como repostera en su casa, hace todo tipo de masas dulces, y siempre está llena de mucho trabajo, ya que son muy aceptadas sus masas. Tiene muy buena mano para ello y le está yendo bien. Le gusta mucho lo que hace, ya que es un trabajo honesto y digno.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos con los cuales quiere seguir haciendo las masas que vende. El grupo agradece por la oportunidad que reciben, pues de esta forma ayudan a sus familias.
texts.en:
These 12 women formed a communal bank in the city of Encarnacion.  They are friends and neighbors from this city, and they got together seeing a great opportunity to make progress and help their families.  They are now in their  4th loan cycle, and they want to continue to grow.

One of the members of this group is Edita.  She has a pastry business that she runs out of her house.  She makes all types of pastries,and she always has a lot of work because her pastries are very popular.  She does very good quality work, and her business is doing well.  She really enjoys her work, because it is honest and decent work.  She is requesting a loan to buy supplies because she wants to continue making the pastries that she sells.  

This group appreciates the opportunity that they are receiving, because it will enable them to help their families.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make pastries, such as flour, butter, eggs, sugar, and other ingredients

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is a hardworking 27-year-old man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a farmer, primarily rearing cattle which he later sells. Like all good fathers he desires to educate his children up to university and build a permanent house, as they are currently living in a semi-permanent house.

Drought and diseases hinder his business. His business plan is to dig wells and also use modern methods of farming. Sam intends to use the loan to buy cattle for rearing.

loans.use: to buy cows for rearing.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres “Virgen del Carmen” tiene 15 miembros, donde las señoras son muy unidas, responsables y solidarias, dicen que tienen muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante, tanto con el grupo y familiarmente.
Estefana es parte de este grupo muy entusiasta, y comenta que trabaja duro para poder ayudar a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de pollos, en lo que le está yendo muy bien, ya que es una buena vendedora y siempre ofrece muy buena calidad a sus clientes. Empezó muy tímidamente, pero después ya se abrió camino y hoy en día ya tiene gran clientela que le hace muchos pedidos.
Solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de pollos, los cuales venderá para seguir ganando los ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: The women's committee, "Virgen del Carmen" has fifteen members.  These women are very united, responsible, and supportive.  They say that they have many desires of working and getting ahead, both with the group and with their families.  Estefana is part of this very enthusiastic group, and she says that she works hard to be able to help her family.  She has a business selling chickens, which is going well.  She is a good saleswoman and always offers good quality to her customers.  She started very timidly, but later she opened up a path for herself, and today she has a large clientele that places a lot of orders with her.  She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of chickens, which she will sell to keep earning income to help her family.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: Do

texts.en:
Do, 54, is married and has three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is retired. Do supports her family by raising pigs and selling noodles to people in her community. Do started her business activities 12 years ago. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business, by buying animal feed for her pigs and good ingredients to make soup to sell. She hopes her business will run smoothly and will generate a higher income, which would assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy animal feed for her pigs and ingredients to make soup for selling.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter, age 33, is a married man who has three children, ages 4 to 12. He lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He owns a bar. He got start-up capital for the bar by saving money he had earned from a cattle trading business that he still runs. He describes himself as a hard-working man, whose ambition is to better his life and those of his children, by educating them up to the University despite the fact that he did not finish college. Price fluctuations and high license fees hinder his business. His dream is to own a big bar in the city. Peter intends to use the loan to buy beer, soda, and spirits to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda, and spirits to sell in his bar.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex, 40, is a married man with six children living in Kagadi, Uganda. After assessing the need in his community, he decided to set up a clinic since most government hospitals lack pharmaceutical drugs. With the income earned, Alex has been able to buy land and expand his clinic. Bad debts and high labor turnover are challenges he faces in his business. Alex's desire is to have a private hospital with qualified personnel. He intends to use this loan to buy pharmaceutical drugs for his clinic.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical drugs for his clinic.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa would like to take another loan to buy materials for making pallets in bulk. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. Hoa hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing sales. She also hopes that through this loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials for making pallets in bulk.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Oanh would like to take another loan to repair her cafe and buy beverages and coffee to sell. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. Oanh hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing sales. She also hopes that through this loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To repair her cafe and buy beverages and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Nhom

texts.en: Nhom is requesting a new loan to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and materials. Nhom's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her to attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and materials

loans.name: Le

texts.en:
Le is 42 years old, is married, and has a son. Her husband is a driver for hire. Le has been running a general store in front of her door for 10 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her child. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Le is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more household items, and many kinds of soft drinks, to stock her store. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her inventory. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more household items, and many kinds of soft drinks, to stock her store.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 27-year-old married man with two children, ages four and one, living in Kagadi, Uganda. Due to his passion for a better life, he started a produce and liquor business seven years ago. During this time, he has been able to build a residential house and also has continued to do farming to supplement his produce business. 

Julius is requesting for a loan to buy a local brew to sell. The challenges of weather and bad roads affect his business. His business plans include buying land and expanding on his farming activities. He dreams of educating his children and buying a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 30-year-old government employee who works as a primary school teacher. A father of three children, he is married and lives in Kagadi, Uganda.

John was inspired to go into the teaching profession by his urge to serve his nation and he feels there is no better way to do this than to teach the children of his nation. He also owns a cattle farm to supplement the low pay he earns as a teacher. His personal goal is to upgrade his studies and become a school principal. John is requesting a loan to pay school fees for himself.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen is requesting a loan to buy several new products to restock her general store, such as food and beverages.  This purchase will help her to meet the needs of her customers better.  Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and to offer a greater variety of products to her customers.  She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing sales, increasing the size of her store, and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages for her general store.

loans.name: Wejdan

texts.en:
Wejdan is 35 years old. As a conservative woman, she asked her husband to appear in the photo instead, as she has applied for this loan to support his business. 

Husni, Wejdan’s husband, has an accessories shop that he wants to improve. In order to accomplish this, they are going to use the loan to bring in new types of accessories to have a variety of products that will suit most tastes, if not all.

loans.use: to bring in new types of accessories

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en:
Rasha is a young married lady. Her husband is a construction worker. They live in a rented home. To work on improving their living conditions while they still have no kids, Rasha has started a small business using the hair dryer she has. 

Her business is still in the very beginning stage. She has applied for this youth loan in order to bring in more hair accessories and hair straightening and curling tools to support and grow her beauty salon business.

loans.use: to bring in more hair accessories and hair straightening and curling tools

loans.name: Koe Pyahu Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación está en su ciclo numero 19, todo esto gracias al empeño que ponen cada una de las integrantes de este comité. Son mujeres jefas de familia, que luchan sin cansarse, pues quieren salir adelante y ayudar a los suyos.
La Sra. Nilda, ella es modista y tiene un taller de costura en una zona céntrica de la ciudad, hace todo tipo de cortinados los cuales son bien vendidos por su buena calidad y buen precio. Nilda es innovadora con sus cortinas, y siempre trata de sobresalir así gana a la competencia. Su meta es poder tener un gran taller de costura, para que también pueda ayudar a otras personas.
Cuenta la Sra. Nilda  que solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos y telas para su taller de costuras. Ella se encuentra  muy agradecida por la oportunidad que reciben.
texts.en:
This group from the city of Encarnación is in its 19th cycle, thanks the effort of its members.  They are women heads of household who work without tiring to get ahead and help their children.

Nilda is modest and has a sewing workshop in the city’s central zone, where she makes all types of drapes which sell well because they are of good quality and good prices.  Nilda is innovative with her drapes and always tries to surpass herself, so she beats out the competition.  Her goal is to have a grand workshop so she can also help other people.

Nilda is asking for this loan to buy fabric and thread for her workshop.  She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: San Pablo Group

texts.es:
San Pablo es un comité de la ciudad de Caacupé, con mucho trabajo y lucha están creciendo y se ayudan mutuamente las unas a las otras. Son mujeres que vieron una gran oportunidad para ellas y sus familias por medio de este programa.
La señora Carmen es la tesorera del comité, ella cuenta con una pequeña cantina  en la cual vende todo tipo de cosas, tiene mucha venta ya que siempre tiene muy bien surtida su cantina. Quiere poder agrandar su negocio y así seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
Pide este crédito para la compra de golosinas y bebidas para surtir su cantina. Agradece por la ayuda que ella y sus amigas del grupo reciben, y se comprometen a mantener el grupo unido y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
“San Pablo” is a group of people from the city of Caacupé who help each other and are growing, with hard work and great effort.  They are women who saw a great opportunity for themselves and for their families through this program. 

Carmen is the treasurer and she has a small pub where she sells all sorts of things.  She makes many sales and always has a good selection but wants to be able to grow her business and continue providing good service to her customers.

She is asking for this loan to buy snacks and drinks for her pub.  She is grateful for the help she and her friends from the group receive.  They are committed to keeping the group together and continuing to work.

loans.use: to buy drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Zohour

texts.en: Zohour, a 38 year old conservative woman, has asked her husband to take her place in the photo. She is a mother of two boys and one girl. Her husband is a steel and machinery junk seller. Zohour loves flowers (that is also the meaning of her name) and the idea of arranging bouquets and decorating vases. She works with plastic or any kind of material when she doesn’t have fresh flowers, and tries to arrange her products in a nice way to be used as decorations in a house. She has applied for this loan to bring in more raw material to enlarge her business and start decorating for weddings and special occasions.

loans.use: to bring in more raw materials for her decorations

loans.name: Baasanjav

texts.en: Baasanjav is a 37 year old widow who lives with her 2 sons in a small house in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband passed away last year. Her two sons, Amarhuu and Anar, are 14 and 13 years old, and are secondary school students. Baasanjav has been working as a tailor for a private tailoring company since 2001. She has gained a lot of experience tailoring modern and traditional clothes on both automatic and manual machines. She is now planning to start her own tailoring business in a spare room of her house, and is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to purchase a sewing machine and inventory for her new business. She is a hardworking, diligent and responsible woman who says: "My sons are soon to be university students and I need to save for their tuition and other expenses from now on since I am the only one who works in the family."

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and inventory for her new tailoring business

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 44-year-old conservative woman. She asked her brother to take her place in the photo.

Iman is a single lady who is looking after her father and her younger brother who recently turned 26 years old. She has a mini-market that is selling some food products, snacks, tissues and some detergents. Now that she has some regular customers, she has decided to improve the quality of products she sells and get more goods her store is missing so they can find most of what they need in her small store. For that purpose, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to improve the quality of products she sells and get more missing goods

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en: Khitam, a 33 year old conservative woman, has asked her husband to appear in the photo instead. She is a mother of three boys, and has applied for this loan to support and help her husband in improving his business. Khalid has a small coffee kiosk where he sells hot drinks and snacks, mostly to taxi drivers. He wants to add more hot drinks besides tea and Turkish coffee, and is thinking of adding a cigarette stand in the future. So Khitam has applied for this loan to bring in more types of drinks, and enhance the working area inside the kiosk so her husband can add more products to sell.

loans.use: to add more types of drinks to sell

loans.name: Yahya

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 30-year-old married father of two children who lives in Haja, Yemen. He has only completed secondary school. He has been running a grocery store for two years. He is a soldier. He has worked very hard to get his family ahead and give them everything they deserve. 

Mohammed started his business by collecting a small amount and his salary. He has attracted more customers and he wants to get more profit. For this reason, he took out a loan of 300,000 YER from AMB in order to supply his business with more products. In the future, he would like to buy a car and enroll his children in private school.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for his business.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en: Denis is a 43 year old married man with six children living in Kagadi, Uganda. A parish chief who was inspired into service by the urge for community development, he also has a motorcycle from which he earns extra income to supplement his low salary. The good father that he is, he dreams of his children getting university education and owning a good residential house. Denis intends to use the loan facility to buy cement and bricks to build his residential house.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks for building his residential house

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock his general store. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers. 

Son's previous loan enabled him to improve his business and offer his customers a greater variety of products. He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his store and the volume of his sales, which will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages to restock his general store.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong requests an additional loan to buy more chickens and ducks to raise and sell. Phuong's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will help her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens and ducks to raise and sell

loans.name: Al-Anwar Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Anwar and is made up of three women and a man who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They took out a loan of 300,000 YER from AMB.

Hayah is a 35-year-old married woman with five children. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. She is working hard to cover her family's expenses. She is requesting a loan of 90,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies for her home. She hopes to build a second floor for her house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her home.

loans.name: Unga-Unga Group

texts.en:
Phelistas is a member of Unga-unga Group in Lugari District. She is pictured with ten One Acre Fund farmers, eight women and two men. Phelistas is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize and sorghum cultivation. Phelistas is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seeds and fertilizer and to grow enough food for the family.

Last year, Phelistas harvested ten bags of maize on two acres of land. She is excited to improve her harvest as a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. She plans to spend the money that she earns from her next harvest on sending her children to school, buying livestock and perhaps investing in another business. Phelistus’ group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for five acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Al-Dm Group

texts.en: This group, Al-Dm, consists of two ladies and two men who live in Taiz, Yemen. Fakhria is a 37-year-old married woman with seven children. She has a small house and intends to renovate it. She applied for a loan of 60000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies. She hopes to have a big house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Mahudjro12 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "MAHUDJRO12" est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Gbessouvègni Brigitte est âgée de 33 ans et est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Gbessouvègni Brigitte est mariée à Fiacre, un mécanicien. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé. Gbessouvègni Brigitte et Fiacre vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Gbessouvègni Brigitte n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a près de six ans que Gbessouvègni Brigitte exerce comme activité, la vente de vivres (maïs, mil) à son domicile; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Gbessouvègni Brigitte désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Gbessouvègni Brigitte sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe  "MAHUDJRO12", un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The "Mahudjro 12" group comprises three people who are friends and live in the same area. The group leader, named Gbessouvègni Brigitte, is 33 years old and has her hand raised in the photo. Gbessouvègni Brigitte is married to Fiacre, a mechanic. The couple have two children, one of whom is in school. Gbessouvègni Brigitte and Fiacre live together with their children and provide for the various household expenses together. Gbessouvègni Brigitte did not attend school. For close to six years, she has run a business selling food items (maize, millet) at her home; this allows her to respond to her family's needs without too much difficulty. With the hope of better responding to the needs of her clientele, Gbessouvègni Brigitte wants to expand her business. To do this, she is seeking a fifth loan with ALIDÉ, along with the other members of the Mahudjro 12 group. The previous loans were all repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and millet.

loans.name: Oluwatogni Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "OLUWATOGNI" est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. les membres de ce groupe font des tontines ensembles et s'approvisionnent au même endroit. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Moïba, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Moïba est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à Thomas. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les diverses charges du foyer. Moïba n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a près de dix ans que Moïba exerce comme activité, la vente de charbon de bois et des chaussures (sandales) à son domicile. Ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Moïba désire acheter de la farine de blé et des sacs de charbons de bois pour renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Moïba sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe "OLUWATOGNI", un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The "Oluwatogni" group comprises three people who are friends. The group members are part of a tontine together and get their supplies at the same location. The group leader, named Moïba, has her hand raised in the photo. Moïba is 41 years old and married to Thomas. The couple have two children, both in school. The couple live together with their children and provide for the household together. Moïba did not attend school. For close to ten years, she has run a business selling charcoal and shoes (sandals) at her home. This allows her to provide for her family without too much difficulty. With the hope of better responding to the needs of her clientele, Moïba would like to buy wheat flour and bags of charcoal to expand her business. To do this, she is seeking a fifth loan with ALIDÉ, along with the other members of the Oluwatogni group. The previous loans were all repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour and charcoal.

loans.name: Nonvignon 5 Group

texts.fr: "NONVIGNON 5" est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier et font des tontines ensemble. La représentante du groupe, Hélène Aimée est âgée de 57 ans, est mariée à Frédéric. Hélène Aimée a un peu fréquenté l'école. Le couple n’a pas d'enfant. Hélène Aimée et son mari vivent ensemble et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Il y a près de dix ans que Hélène Aimée vend divers articles (riz, farine de manioc, etc.) à son domicile. Hélène Aimée exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Hélène Aimée s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Hélène Aimée sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe "NONVIGNON 5", un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: The "Nonvignon 5" group comprises three people who live in the same area and are part of a tontine together. The group leader, Hélène Aimée, is 57 years old and married to Frédéric. Hélène Aimée has had limited schooling. The couple have no children. Hélène Aimée and her husband live together and provide for the household together. For close to ten years, Hélène Aimée has sold various items (rice, manioc flour, etc.) at her home. She runs this business passionately, and it allows her to provide for herself. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. With the goal of satisfying her customers, Hélène Aimée is seeking a fourth loan with ALIDÉ, along with the other members of the Nonvignon 5 group. This loan will help them better respond to the needs of their customers and earn higher profits.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, maize, condiments, and various other items.

loans.name: Twitezimbere Group

texts.fr:
Consolate fait partie du groupe  Twitezimbere et   habite à Gitega. Elle a   59 ans et est mariée à Nkunzimana, un fonctionnaire. Ensemble ils ont  3 enfants, âgés de 14  à 19ans, et tous étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge son frère qui projette faire l’auto école.

Elle fait le commerce de la bière industrielle et de la limonade  depuis 12 ans. 

Elle est à son  dix-huitième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de  caisses de bière et de limonade à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Les gains de commerce, lui permettent de réussir  sa vie et de préparer  l’avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Consolate belongs to the "Twitezimbere" group and lives in Gitega. She is 59 years old and married to Nkunzimana, a civil servant. Together, they have three children, aged 14 through 19, all of whom are in school.
She also takes care of her brother, who intends to attend automotive school.

She has run a business selling mass-produced beer and soda for twelve years.

She is on her 18th loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan she obtains, she is going to increase her capital and buy several cases of beer and soda for resale in order to earn more.

The profit from her business allow her to succeed in life and prepare for her children's future.

loans.use: To increase her capital and buy many cases of beer and soda for resale, in order to earn more.

loans.name: Baatar-Ochir

texts.en:
Baatar-Ochir is 39 years old. He lives with his wife and 3 children in a small house in the Hentii province of Mongolia. His wife Nandintsetseg, 37, works at a local hospital as an assistant doctor. His older son Sodbileg, 11, goes to a local school and his younger son, Gunbileg, 5, goes to a local kindergarten. 

Baatar-Ochir has been driving a big truck since 1995 for a private mining company. He has gained a lot of experience over the years and now he is planning to start a business providing transportation services for mining projects using his own truck. He needs 5,500,000 MNT to purchase new wheels in order to provide his transportation services without problems. He is a hardworking, well-behaved and responsible person.

loans.use: to purchase new wheels

loans.name: Bathishig

texts.en: Bathishig is 32 years old. She lives with her mother and 2 siblings in a small house in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her mother has retired and stays home. Her 2 siblings are university students. Bathishig has been operating a small cafe in the center of the province with her business partner since 2011. She has expanded her business and opened a bakery in the spare room of the cafe. She rents the business premises with her partner. She is now requesting 2,500,000 MNT to pay her two siblings' university tuition fees and other expenses. She is a hardworking and diligent woman.

loans.use: to pay her two siblings' university tuition fees and other expenses

loans.name: Bathurel

texts.en:
Mr. Bathurel is 42 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger (Mongolian housing tent) in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife, Oyunchimeg, produces shoes at home by customer order and also takes care of their daughter, Baigalmaa, who is the age of 5 and also goes to a local kindergarten. His sons Bathurel and Bayandalai, age of 13 and 6, go to a local school.
