The borrower has been manufacturing wooden furniture by customer order since 2008. Wooden furniture manufacture is seasonal and not very fulfilling of their family expenses, so he is planning to start a business of meat retail in local market. He already found a rental counter and now needs an additional 4'000'000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase a large amount of livestock to produce meat for his newly starting butcher shop. He is a hardworking, honest and responsible person.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of livestock to produce meat for his newly starting butcher shop

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 25-year-old married man who works in the defense department. Ali wants to elevate his educational level, so he enrolled himself in a university where he is continuing to get a degree and improve his military level in this way.

Now he applied for this loan so he can pay for his next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester fees.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a 36-year-old mother of six children, four of whom attend school. She lives in a one-room house with her six children and her husband.  She has been selling crockery for many years, and offers various products such as plates, glasses, bowls, etc. She sells them door-to-door and makes enough to lead a decent life. 

In order to buy more items of crockery Rani contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 15,000. She intends to use this money to buy a greater  variety of glasses, dinner sets and bowls in different sizes. This will improve her earnings through her large sales. She wants to spend the part of profits on buying a new house and she also dreams of providing a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of glasses, dinner sets and bowls in different sizes.

loans.name: Bayanmunh

texts.en:
Mr.Bayanmonh is 39 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children in Ger in Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia.  His wife Mart, age 38, has been helping with his business of traditional wrestling costume for 6 years now.  His son Bayarsaihan, age19, is in military service and his daughters Batchimeg and Battsetseg, ages15 and 14 are secondary school students. 

He has been in this business for the last 6 years and has already gained a lot of experience and customers over the years.  He is requesting 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory to produce more traditional wrestling costumes.  He is a hardworking, modest and responsible person.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and materials for making more traditional wrestling costumes

loans.name: Al-Tharbh Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Tharbh, which consists of 6 ladies and man who live in Taiz, Yemen.  Samah is the leader of this group.  She is an illiterate woman who is 26 years old and lives in Taiz, Yemen.  She is the mother of five children.

She has made efforts herself to raise her children well.  She has a house and she would like to provide them a comfortable life.  She applied for a youth loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.name: Bazarragchaa

texts.en:
Mrs.Bazarragchaa is widow who lives with her daughter's family in small house in Darhan province of Mongolia.  Her daughter Dashdavaa works at a private company as an assistant worker.  Her son-in-law operates a micro-business of his own.  Their daughters, Ariunjargal, age 13 goes to local school and Ariun-Erdene, age 3 goes to thew local kindergarten. 

She has been operating the business of producing barley flour since 2004.  Her business has not been growing much since then because she works with her brother and they did not have enough working capital to expand the business.  They produce barley flour and sell it to Ulaanbaatar flour retailers at a wholesale price.  She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase large amounts of barley to produce barley flour during winter.  She is a hardworking, kind and diligent person.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of barley to produce barley flour during winter

loans.name: Shehab Group

texts.en: This group is called Shehab which consists of 5 ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen.  They applied for a loan of 230,000 YER.  Afrah is a 44 year old married woman who lives in Taiz.  She intends to buy a home appliance.  She applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy a fridge for her house.  She hopes to improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy fridge for her house.

loans.name: Ridwane-Laï Group

texts.fr: " RIDWANE-LAÏ " est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres s'approvisionnent au même endroit et font des tontines ensemble. La représentante du groupe, Moïbatou est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo, est âgée de 44 ans est mariée à Antoine, un meunier. Moïbatou n’a pas fréquenté l'éécole. Le couple à deux enfants, aucun d’eux n’est scolarisés. Moïbatou vit seule avec ses enfants. Moïbatou assure toute seule les différentes charges de la maison. Moïbatou vend de la nourriture, du maïs et du riz à son domicile. Moïbatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir sans grande difficulté, à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Moïbatou et les autres membres du groupe  " RIDWANE-LAÏ " sollicitent pour une cinquième fois, l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
"Ridwane-Laï" is a group of 3 people whose members get their supplies in the same area and belong to the same tontines. The group's leader, Moïbatou, is the one whose hand is raised in the picture. She is 44 years old and is married to Antoine, a miller. Moïbatou did not go to school. The couple have 2 children, neither of whom attend school. Moïbatou lives alone with her children and takes care of the different household responsibilities by herself.

Moïbatou sells food, corn and rice from her home. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. This business allows her to meet her needs and those of her children without too much difficulty.

Moïbatou and the other members of the "Ridwane-Laï" group are requesting financial support from ALIDé for the fifth time, with a view to strengthening their businesses and better meeting the demands of their customers. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a resident of the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She is a single mother of one child. Christine owns a retail shop, a business that she has been running for two years. Christine began the business through the savings she made from casual jobs. In this shop, she sells ropes, brooms etc.

She learned about Milango from other clients and joined the institution with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is price fluctuations.
   
Christine is applying for a loan of 10,700 Kenya shillings to purchase brooms and ropes etc., for sale. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her the living standard. She aspires to own other centers and to plan for her child’s education with much security.

loans.use: to purchase brooms and ropes etc for sale.

loans.name: Ife Oluwa 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe " IFE OLUWA 1 " est formé de trois personnes qui font des tontines ensemble et exercent presque les mêmes activités et s’approvisionnent dans un même endroit. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Hounsi Mègbè, âgée de 57 ans, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Hounsi Mègbè est une veuve. Hounsi Mègbè a deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé. Hounsi Mègbè vit seule avec ses enfants et assurent seule les différentes charges de la maison. Hounsi Mègbè n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a près de quatorze ans que Hounsi Mègbè exerce comme activité, la vente de nourriture (riz accompagné de sauce) à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Hounsi Mègbè désire acheter des sacs de riz et des bidons d’huiles pour renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Hounsi Mègbè sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe " IFE OLUWA 1 ", un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group "Ife Oluwa 1" is composed of 3 people who belong to the same tontines, have similar businesses and get their supplies in the same area. The group's representative, Hounsi Mègbè, is 57 years old and has her hand raised in the picture. Hounsi Mègbè is a widow. She has 2 children, one of whom goes to school. Hounsi Mègbè lives alone with her children and takes care of the different household responsibilities by herself. She did not go to school.

Hounsi Mègbè has been selling food (rice with sauce) from her home for nearly 14 years; this enables her to meet her family's needs without too much difficulty. In order to better be able to respond to the demands of her customers, Hounsi Mègbè would like to buy some bags of corn and some cans of oil to strengthen her business. In order to do this, she and the other members of the "Ife Oluwa 1" group are requesting a 3rd loan from ALIDé. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and cans of vegetable oil.

loans.name: L’Amour De Dieu Group

texts.fr: Le groupe " L’AMOUR DE DIEU " est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies qui s'approvisionnent au même endroit. Le représentant de ce groupe, nommé Jules, âgé de 31 ans, est celui dont la main est levée sur la photo. Jules est marié à Josiane, une marchande. Le couple à trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Jules et Josiane vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Jules a peu fréquenté l'école. Jules est couturier ; il y a de cela quinze ans que Jules exerce comme activité, la vente de chemises et des pantalons dans son atelier ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux d’acheter des fournitures de couture et des tissus pantalons pour répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Jules désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Jules sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe " L’AMOUR DE DIEU ", un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group "L'amour de dieu" is made up of 3 people who are friends and get their supplies in the same area. The group's representative, Jules, is 31 years old and has his hand raised in the picture. Jules is married to Josiane, a merchant. The couple have 3 children, some of whom go to school. Jules and Josiane live together with their children and take care of the different household responsibilities together. Jules did not get much schooling.

Jules is a tailor and has been selling shirts and trousers in his workshop for 15 years; this enables him to meet his family's needs without too much difficulty. Jules would like to strengthen his business and be able to buy sewing supplies so that he can better respond to his customer demand. In order to do this, he and the other members of the "L'amour de dieu" group are requesting their first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and trouser fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Bujin

texts.en:
Bujin is 28 years old and lives with her husband and 2 daughters in small house in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband works at construction company. Her daughter Uuganzul, age 8, goes to primary school and her younger daughter Bayanzul, age 2, goes to the local kindergarten. 

She has been clothes designer since 2001 right after she had graduated from the university as designer and started working as assistant designer at well-known private clothes tailoring business. She has just started her own tailoring business few months ago but she has already has a lot of experience and clients within the area. 

She is now requesting 4'000'000MNT to purchase more inventory to meet clients' orders and she is also planning to purchase a car for both family and business use. She is hardworking, diligent and responsible.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to meet clients' orders and she is also planning to purchase a car for both family and business use.

loans.name: Safari

texts.en:
Safari is a resident of the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. He is a married father of three children. Safari owns a retail shop, a business that he has been running for nine years. He began the business through the savings he made from casual jobs. In this shop, he sells goods such as ropes and brooms.

Safari learnt about Milango from other clients and joined the institution with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of his business. The main challenges he faces are high taxation and market fees. 
  
Safari is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase more brooms, ropes and other goods to sell. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve his family's living standards. He aspires to own other centers and plans to provide his children with a secure education.

loans.use: To purchase brooms, ropes and other goods to sell.

loans.name: Jesudogigo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe " JESUDOGIGO " est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Le représentant de ce groupe, nommé Paul, âgé 36 ans, est celui dont la main est levée sur la photo. Paul est marié à Brigitte. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et deux sont à leur charge. Paul et Brigitte vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Paul a un peu fréquenté l'école. Paul vend des pièces détachées depuis près de six ans ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire ses clients, Paul désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Paul sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe " JESUDOGIGO ", un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé, dans le but d’acheter des pièces détachées pour renforcer sa boutique.
texts.en:
The group "Jesudogigo" is made up of 3 people who live in the same area. The group's representative, Paul, is 36 years old and has his hand raised in the picture. Paul is married to Brigitte. The couple have 5 children, some of whom go to school and 2 of whom are in their charge. Paul and Brigitte live together with their children and take care of the different household responsibilities together. Paul did not get much schooling.

Paul has been selling spare parts for nearly 6 years; this enables him to meet his family's needs without too much difficulty. Paul would like to strengthen his business so that he can better satisfy his customers. In order to do this, Paul, together with the other members of the "Jesudogigo" group, is requesting his first loan from ALIDé, so that he can buy spare parts to increase his shop's inventory.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita, de 69 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Pedro y sus 2 nietos: Luis y Sergio a los que quiere mucho y juntos viven en la casa que heredó hace 50 años. Desde muy joven aprendió todo lo necesario del campo, como producirlo y sacarlo adelante. Gracias a sus padres, obtuvo los terrenos agrícolas que le ayudó a sacar adelante a sus 7 hijos, los cuales se encuentran saludables e independientes, “cada uno con su familia”, menciona. 
Ella es una mujer extraordinaria, cuida de sus nietos, pues sus padres murieron. Por ese motivo continuo sembrando papa, maíz y alfalfa, los cuales comercializa en sus mismos terrenos agrícolas, además de poseer animales como vacas, ovejas, toros, los cuales comercializa cuando se encuentran maduros. Pero como desea brindar lo mejor a sus sobrinos, hace algunos años comenzó a vender alimentos en el cafetín de la escuela de su pueblo, donde obtiene ingresos adicionales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Manantiales de Ullusca” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero brindado, pues le ayuda a mejorar su negocio. Por esa razón, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Felicita, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico y semilla de alfalfa para nutrir sus sembríos y así tener el alimento de sus ganados.
texts.en:
Felicita is 69 years old and is a simple woman.  She lives with her husband, Pedro, and her two grandchildren, Luis and Sergio, whom she loves very much.  They live together in the home she inherited 50 years ago.  She learned what she needed to know to work in the fields when she was young.  Thanks to her parents, she got the farmland that helped get her family and seven children ahead.  They are all healthy and on their own, “each with his own family,” she says. 

A few years ago she decided to sell some food in the local school cafeteria in order to earn extra money and provide the best for her grandchildren.  She is a member of the “Manantiales de Ullusca” communal bank and this is her third cycle with MFP.  She is grateful for the loan because it helps her improve her business and she promises to be on time with her payments.

Felicita will use the money from this loan to buy compost and alfalfa seed to maintain her crops and be able to feed her livestock.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a resident of Mariakani in Coast Province, Kenya. She is a single business lady. Harriet owns a retail shop, a business that she has been running for two years. Harriet began the business through the savings she made from casual jobs. In this shop, she sells ropes, brooms, etc. She learned about Milango from other clients and joined the institution with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of her business. Her main challenges are bad debts, high market fees, and taxation.

Harriet is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenyan shillings to purchase brooms, ropes, etc. for sale. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to help open a salon business. She aspires to own other centers and plan for her child’s education with much security.

loans.use: to purchase brooms, ropes, etc. for sale

loans.name: Grace Divine 5 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe " GRACE DIVINE 5 " est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Jossée Edith Sylvie, est âgée 33 ans. Jossée Edith Sylvie est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Jossée Edith Sylvie est mariée à un certain Thierry. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Jossée Edith Sylvie et Thierry vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Jossée Edith Sylvie a un peu fréquenté l’école. Jossée Edith Sylvie vend de fruits, des plastiques et des assiettes dans un marché du Bénin depuis une vingtaine d’année, ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire ces clients, Jossée Edith Sylvie désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Jossée Edith Sylvie sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GRACE DIVINE 5, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, dans le but d'acheter des ustensiles de cuisine et des fruits. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group "Grace Divine 5" is made up of 3 people who are friends and live in the same district. The group's representative, Jossée Edith Sylvie, is 33 years old. She is the one who has her hand raised in the picture. Jossée Edith Sylvie is married to Thierry. The couple have 3 dependent children, some of whom go to school. Jossée Edith Sylvie and Thierry live together with their children and take care of the different household responsibilities together. Jossée Edith Sylvie has had some formal education.

Jossée Edith Sylvie has been selling fruits, plastic items and plates at a market in Benin for around 20 years, which enables her to meet her family's needs without too much difficulty. Jossée Edith Sylvie would like to strengthen her business so that she can better satisfy her customers. In order to do this, Jossée Edith Sylvie, is requesting her 3rd loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the "Grace Divine 5" group, so that she can buy kitchen utensils and fruit. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and fruit.

loans.name: Missebo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe " MISSEBO " est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Joséphine, âgé 36 ans, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Joséphine est marié à Joël, un cultivateur. Le couple a huit enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Joséphine et Joël vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Joséphine a peu fréquenté l'école. Joséphine vend divers articles, Joséphine procède aussi à la transformation des noix de palme depuis près de douze ans ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire ces clients, Joséphine désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Joséphine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe " MISSEBO ", un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé, dans le but d’acheter des noix de palme, du vin de palme et divers articles. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group "Missebo" is made up of 3 people who are friends and live in the same area. The group's representative, Joséphine, is 36 years old and has her hand raised in the picture. Joséphine is married to Joël, a farmer. The couple have 8 children, some of whom go to school. Joséphine and Joël live together with their children and take care of the different household responsibilities together. Joséphine has had little schooling.

Joséphine has been selling various items and processing palm nuts for nearly 12 years, which enables her to meet her family's needs without too much difficulty. Joséphine would like to strengthen her business so that she can better satisfy her customers. In order to do this, Joséphine is requesting her 4th loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the "Missebo" group, so that she can buy palm nuts, palm wine and various other items. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts, palm wine and other items.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine witnessed a great boost in income after receiving her previous loan. She was also able to start selling charcoal. 

She is now asking for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to help her reconstruct her cafe in preparation for the festive season and also buy more stocks of food. 

Josphine still has the ambition of setting up a hotel.

loans.use: to reconstruct her cafe and buy stocks of food.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is the married mother of five grown-up children. Rose owns a charcoal stall which she has been operating for six months. 

Rose learnt about Milango through a friend and joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. The challenges she is facing are bad debts and a lack of enough capital to expand her business, an issue she feels will be partly sorted by this new application/loan.  

Rose is applying for a loan of 21,050 KES to buy additional stocks of charcoal. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand the business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stock of tents and increase the float for her money transfer business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a crop farmer who lives in Likoni, Kenya. She has been in the business for the last six years. She has three children. 

Judith sees potential in agribusiness and would like to expand the acreage she farms. She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to plough her fields and buy seeds.

Her current challenge in business is the unpredictable climatic conditions, but Judith believes she will make a profit with this investment.

loans.use: to plough her fields and buy seeds.

loans.name: Nozimjon

texts.ru: Нозимджону 25 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Его жена домохозяйка и занимается воспитанием детей. Дети у них еще маленькие, старшему 3 года, а младшему 1,5 года. Нозимджон очень целеустремленный и трудолюбивый человек. С целью получения дохода 6 лет назад он начал свой бизнес купле продажей топлива. Так как спрос большой для покупки топлива, Нозимджон хочет увеличить свой оборотный капитал. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки топлива. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Nozimjon is 25 years old. He is married and is raising two children. His wife is a housewife and raises the children. Their children are still young, the eldest one is three years old and the youngest one is 1.5 years old. Nozimjon is a very purposeful and hardworking man. 

In order to get an income, Nozimjon started his business of buying and reselling fuel 6 years ago. As the demand for fuel is large, Nozimjon would like to increase his working capital. He requests a loan in the amount of 3,000 somoni for the purchase of fuel. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase fuel to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in Changamwe in Coast Province, Kenya and has three children. 

She owns a food cafe, a business that she has been running for ten years. She sells cooked potatoes, beverages and buns.

She learnt about Milango from an employee and joined the institution with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge has been bad debts and the high cost of food.

Mariam is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to purchase wheatflour and sugar. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the family's living standards, especially the education of her children. 

She aspires to own a hotel in future.

loans.use: to purchase wheatflour and sugar.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a resident of the Changamwe area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has three children. Catherine owns a retail shop, selling foodstuffs like sugar, bread, milk, and soap. It is a business that she has been running for seven years. She received the start-up capital from her husband, whose formal employment also provides income for the family.

She learnt about Milango from other clients and joined the institution with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are the high costs of stock and bad debts. She desires to own a wholesale shop in the future.

Catherine is applying for a loan of 31,500 KES to purchase flour, cooking oil, sugar, and other items. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her living standards. She aspires to own other centers and pay for her child’s education with much security.

loans.use: to purchase flour, cooking oil, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Gulnigor

texts.ru: Гулнигору 43 года, она вдова и на воспитании имеет 3  детей. Дети Зарнигор, Фуркат и Камилчон. Им 18, 16 и 9 лет. Она очень трудолюбивый человек и имеет более чем 1 года опыта в бизнесе. Она занимается куплей продажей веников. Она продает веники на местном рынке и имеет своих клиентов. В зимнее время будет больше спроса на веники и поэтому она должна срочно расширить свой ассортимент для нового сезона. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для того, чтобы купить веники. Она надеется на вас и на вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulnigor is 43 years old. She is a widow and is raising three children. Her children are called Zarnigor, Furkat and Kamilchon, and they are 18, 16 and 9 years old. 

Gulnigor is a very hardworking person and has more than a year of experience in her business. She works with buying and reselling brooms. She sells brooms at the local market and has her customers. In the winter time there is larger demand for brooms and therefore Gulnigor should immediately expand her assortment for the new season. 

She requests a loan in the amount of 1,500 somoni in order to purchase brooms. She sets her hope with you and your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase brooms to sell

loans.name: Nargis

texts.ru: Нарису 31 года. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Она очень трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина.  Она работает в банке более 5 лет. Она является одной из лучших работников и все коллеги ее очень уважают. Она тратит свою зарплату на жизнь и не может сделать сбережения для покупки нужных технологий для дома. Она уже несколько лет планирует купить телевизор, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1900 сомони для покупки телевизора. Она обещает оплатить займ во время. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Nargis is 31 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. She is a very hardworking and purposeful woman. She has been working at a bank for more than five years. She is one of the best workers and all her colleagues respect her very much. 

Nargis spends her salary on living and cannot save for purchasing necessary technology for her home. She has planned to purchase a new TV for several years, but does not have the money. She requests a loan in the amount of 1,900 somoni for the purchase of a TV. She promises to repay the loan on time. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a TV set for her household

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. He runs a motorcycle transport business in the area. This mode of transport is preferred by many who lack enough money for other transportation and also for movement within short distances in the area. He began the business three years ago.
Harrison was introduced to Milango by his friends and is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to add to his savings and to purchase another motorcycle.
Harrison will save the additional income obtained from this loan. The current challenges in the motorcycle transport business are theft of cycles and the high cost of fuel and spare tires. He hopes to own many more motorcycles as he has seen the returns in the business.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru:
Мухаббат   молодая женщина. У нее одна дочка. К сожалению несколько лет назад Мухаббат развелась с мужем. Она живет со своей мамой и братом.  Мухаббат работает в частном учреждении, техничкой. Она старается помогать своей маме. Она очень пунктуальная и ответственная женщина.
  Недавно Мухаббат  провела косметический ремонт в доме.  Теперь хочет приобрести мебель для дома. Она хочет создать уют для своей мамы и дочери, хочет чтобы они жили в удобстве. Но чтобы купить мебель ей не хватает денежных средств. Поэтому Мухаббат  обратилась в МДО "Арванд" чтобы получить кредит для приобретения мебели и необходимых вещей для дома.
  Мухаббат заранее благодарит Арванд за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is a young woman. She has a daughter. Unfortunately, Muhabbat divorced from her husband a few years ago. She lives with her mother and brother. Muhabbat works as a cleaner at a private institution. She tries to help her mother. She is a very punctual and responsible woman. 

Muhabbat recently did repairs to the house. Currently she would like to purchase furniture for the house. She wants to make it nice for her mother and daughter, and wants them to live in comfort. But she does not have enough money to purchase furniture. Therefore Muhabbat turned to "MDO Arvand" in order to get a loan for the purchase of furniture and necessary items for the home. 

Muhabbat thanks Arvand in advance for the help and support.

loans.use: to purchase furniture

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Marta, de 49 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de 2 de sus 4 hijos: Yanela y Ángelo, a los que cuida en la casa de su padre, donde vive desde hace 30 años.  Hace 4 años enviudó, es así que tomo la rienda de su familia y sus hijos a los que quiere mucho. Es trabajadora estable en un colegio del estado de su localidad, donde labora todos los días. Su principal ingreso económico lo obtiene del salario que recibe mensual, el  que está destinado a los estudios superiores de su hijo, quien estudia en la capital, “deseo darle lo mejor”, afirma. Pero como tiene muchas responsabilidades económicas, tuvo la idea de vender comida en el pueblo donde trabaja, en carpa que ubica estratégicamente en la escuela donde trabaja, ya que es conocida, pues tiene 23 años laborando. Le va muy bien en su negocio y gracias a sus ganancias puede tener un ingreso extra.  Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Manantiales de Ullusca” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero brindado, pues le ayuda a mejorar su negocio. Por esa razón, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Marta, invertirá el dinero en la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Marta is 49 years old and is a hardworking woman.  She lives with two of her four children, Yanela and Ángelo, whom she cares for in their father’s house, where she has lived for 30 years.  She became a widow four years ago, so she took the family reins; she loves her children very much.  She has a steady job at the local public school, works where daily, and receives a monthly salary, which she uses to pay for her son’s higher education.  He is studying in the capital and wants to “give him the best,” as she says.

Since she has many financial responsibilities, she got the idea of selling food from a tent, located near the school, in the town where she works.  She is already known there because she’s been working there for 23 years.  Things have gone well for her business and thanks to it she has been able to have an extra income.  She is a member of the “Manantiales de Ullusca” and this is her fourth cycle with MFP.  She is grateful for the financial support because it has helped her improve her business.  This is the reason she is committed to being on time with her payments.  Martha will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients to prepare her food.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a resident of Malindi in Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married mother with four school-age children. Patience runs a clothes shop which she has operated for two years. She also manages several rental houses.
She learned about Milango through an employee and joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are competition and bad debts. She believes that through this loan, she can improve her business.
Patience is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenyan shillings to purchase clothes to sell. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her standard of living. She aspires to be a large scale supplier of secondhand clothes.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima's previous loan was a great boost to the business. She was able to purchase the [sewing] machines and now supplies even school uniforms. Her ambition is to own a large boutique.

Halima is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenyan shillings to buy additional stock of cloth / materials for dressmaking. She believes this can help her catch the demand over the festive season and in preparation for the January rush for school opening.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of cloth / materials for dressmaking.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a resident of Malindi of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has four children; all of whom attend school. Agnes owns a tailoring shop, a business that she has been running for seven years. She has also been in the dairy farming business. She learnt about Milango from an employee and joined the institution with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is bad debts.

Agnes is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenyan shillings to purchase clothes materials and milk for sale. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and milk for her businesses.

loans.name: Mukambe

texts.en:
Mukambe lives in the Changamwe area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has one child. She owns a grocery stall which she has been operating for almost two years. In this business, Mukambe sells vegetables, fish, etc.

Mukambe learnt about Milango from a friend. Her aim is to access credit to improve her business operations. The challenges she is facing are price fluctuation and inflation, purchasing stock and seasonal business climate.

Mukambe is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenyan shillings to buy vegetables wholesale and fish. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand the business. Her plans for the future are to start other businesses.

loans.use: to buy vegetables wholesale and fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a blender, cooler and some clothes for sale.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has three children; all of whom are in school. She owns a retail shop for selling juice and the business has been operating for two years. Amina started the business through her personal savings. 

Amina learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group. She joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are price fluctuations and inflation. She looks forward to owning a permanent business premise in future.

Amina is applying for a loan of 5,650 Kenya shillings to buy a juice cooler box. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to help her pay the loan. Her future plan is to expand to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy a juice cooler box.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cosmetics and hair products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy potatoes.

loans.name: Shalva

texts.en:
Shalva is 34 years old. He lives is a small village of Samtredia district, West Georgia with his wife, 2 daughters and parents. His parents are provided with a retirement pension. Shalva is a watchman at a local school and gets monthly income. 

The family runs agricultural activities. In particular, they have 2 calves, whose milk is used in cheese production. Monthly, they sell approximately 40 kg of cheese locally in an open market at a good price. Additionally, they have 2 hectares of agricultural land where maize and nut trees are grown. The harvested products are sold locally. 

Shalva is a very hardworking man and has a rich experience in his business. Shalva requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow. After purchasing an additional milk cow, they will be able to produce more dairy products and increase sales. It will increase the income of the family and they will be able to improve their living conditions. Shalva awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Najobat

texts.ru: Начобат добросовестная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она живет в не большом городе вместе с семьей. У нее 3 детей и они учатся в средней школе. Ее муж уехал в Российскую Федерацию в целях найти подходящею работу. Начобат работает бухгалтером в организации и имеет многолетний опыт. Дополнительно она занимается переработкой абрикоса. Полученную зарплату и доход от переработки абрикоса, она использует для покупки продуктов питания, одежду и образования детей. Она ели-ели справляется с расходами, так как ее муж мало отправляет деньги. Начобат и ее семья живут в старом доме, где необходимо проводить капитальный ремонт. В ее доме нет никаких условий для проведения зимы, а также ее дом не отвечает стандартам жилья и она срочно должна отремонтировать свой дом. Дети всегда просят родителей отремонтировать их дом, но их доход не позволяет им сделать ремонт. Начобат запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Начобат и ее дети будут ждать вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Najobat is a conscientious and hardworking woman. She lives in a small city together with her family. She has three children who go to high school. Her husband has gone to the Russian Federation in order to find suitable work. 

Najobat works as an accountant at an organization and has many years of experience. In addition she works with processing apricots. She spends her salary and the income from processing apricots on purchasing food products, clothing and the children's education. She can hardly cope with the expenses as her husband sends little money. 

Najobat and her family lives in an old house, where it is necessary to carry out maintenance. Her house is in no condition for the winter, and further the house does not meet living standards and she should immediately repair it. The children always ask their parents to repair their house, but their income does not allow them to do it. 

Najobat requests a loan in the amount of 1,000 somoni for the purchase of building materials for the repair of the house. Najobat and her children will await your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for repairing her house

loans.name: Nazibrola

texts.en:
Nazibrola is 56 years old and is from a small village of the Samtredia district. She lives with her husband, daughter, and 2 infant grandchildren. Nazibrola’s son-in-law died suddenly. Her grandchildren became orphans and have orphan pensions. 

The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese production. They sell cheese locally in an open market at a good price. They also have 26 goats and sell kids locally. 

Nazibrola is a very hard working woman and does her best to improve living conditions for the family. She requested a loan to purchase a milk cow. After purchasing an additional milk cow, they will be able to produce more dairy products and thus increase the sales of dairy products. This will significantly increase the income of the family. Nazibrola awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Konstantine

texts.en:
Konstantine is 34 years old. He lives with his mother in a small village in the Abasha district. His mother is provided with a retirement pension. 

Konstantine is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has 4 milk cows and 4 calves, whose milk is used in cheese production. His mother produces cheese and sells locally in an open market at a good price. Konstantine also owns agricultural land and sows maize and sells harvested maize locally. Konstantine is a very hard working man and has a rich experience in his business. 

Konstantine requested a loan for purchasing building materials for a shed. As the existing shed was destroyed and was too small, he plans to build new one. After building the shed properly, he will be able to expand his dairy farm and increase production of dairy products. This will cause increased income and they will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and build a shed

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
This is 46 year-old Musu.  She is married and has 3 children aged 22, 17 and 13. She has 2 additional dependents, who live with her because of their schooling.  In 1987, Musu established a plastic and dishes business, which she began in order to enhance her independence. Her business is located at the heart of town and her main customers are both men and women. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 420,000 every month. 

Musu has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan of SLL 4,000,000 in order to buy plastic and rubber dishes. She hopes that this loan will help increase her capital base and lead to more merchandise for sale. In the future, Musu plans to own a house, educate her children, and seek more funds for expansion. She says thanks to Kiva, and appreciates the gesture she is receiving. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy plastic and rubber dishes

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
Batbayar is 33 years old, married and lives with his wife, son and daughter in outer ger district of the Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. The place where he lives lacks basic infrastructure. Since 1995, he has been operating a carpentry business with his father. Now his wife helps him in his work. 

He makes earrings, bracelets, necklaces and other accessories with silver, gold and other metals.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as silver metals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
This is Joshua. He is 43 years old, married, and has an 18 month old child. In 1997, Joshua established a local foodstuff business. He started this business because he needed a source of income so that he would not continue to be dependent on his father for all his needs. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 950,000 every month. 

Joshua requires a loan of SLL 4,500,000 in order to increase his stock of palm oil, as this is the season that palm oil, coconuts, groundnuts and oranges are bought at a reduced rate from the farmers. In the future, Joshua plans to give his only daughter a good education and buy a piece of land where he wants to build a house for his family. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy palm oil for his business

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: This is 32 year old Ibrahim.  He is married and has 1 child, aged 5. In 1997, Ibrahim established his poultry business. He began his business after he lost his mother at the age of 9, and took over her business. His business is located on the outskirts of his community and his main customers are women and men. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about  SLL 600,000 every month. Ibrahim requires a loan of  SLL 3,000,000 in order to purchase 50 dozen chickens for resale. He hopes that this loan will support him in his effort to get more poultry barns. In the future, Ibrahim plans to finish his house and to become a poultry distributor. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more chickens

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en: This is 35 year old Mabinty. She is married and has 2 children aged 15 and 10 years. She has 1 additional dependent, who lives with her for the purposes of schooling.  In 2008, Mabinty established her charcoal business, which she inherited from her late mother. Her business is located in the outskirts of her community and her main customers are women. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about SLL 600,000 every month. Mabinty requires a loan of SLL 3,000,000 in order to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her in her effort to earn more profits. In the future, she plans to get a piece of land and erect a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: This is 43 year old Isatu.  She is single and has two children aged 15 and 10 years. She has 1 additional dependent,  who lives with her for the purposes of schooling.  In 1992, Isatu established her pharmaceutical business, which she began because she wants to help in bringing up her children. Her business is located in the outskirts of town and her main customers are women, men and children. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 400,000 every month. Isatu requires a loan of SLL 3,000,000 in order to purchase more drugs for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her in her effort to open a clinic of her own and to educate her children to a university level. In the future, Isatu plans get a house as well as educating her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more medicine

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net and other fishing equipment for her fishing/fish vending business.

Arlyn has been in this business for 8 years. Arlyn also earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut meat.

Arlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net and other fishing equipment for her business

loans.name: Consolita

texts.en:
Consolita is 62 years old and married with four children.

Consolita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a store selling native products in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of native products to sell.

Consolita has borrowed and paid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the store selling native products for 20 years and also earns an income from farming rice and a general store.

Consolita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of native products to sell

loans.name: Adelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Adelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport and selling dried coconut meat. Adelyn is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like snack foods, noodles, soap, sugar, etc. for her general store business.

Adelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store like snack foods, noodles, soap, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Emeleta

texts.en:
Emeleta is 55 years old and married with 7 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Emeleta is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

Emeleta has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from fishing and food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Farhunda

texts.ru: Фархунда родилась в 1976 года в семье служащего. С детства она мечтала работать в финансовой структуре государства. По семейным обстоятельствам в 1993 году она поступила в факультет Иностранных языков и закончила в 1998 году по специальности преподавателя английского языка.  Уже 14 лет она работает в школе учительницей английского языка. Ее зарплата не хватает на жизнь и поэтому она в этом году поступила в Таджикский Государственный Университет Коммерции по специальности финансы и кредит в 3 курс с целью получения второго образования и будущим найти подходящую работу с высокой зарплатой, чтобы хватило для содержания 3 детей. Ее муж врач и его зарплата не хватает помочь жене для оплаты учебного договора. Фархунда с целью получения займа обратилась в нашу организацию. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Farhunda was born in 1976 into a military family.  She has dreamed of working in the government financial sector since childhood.  Due to family obligations, she was accepted to the foreign languages department in 1993 and graduated with an English-language speciality in 1998.  She has been working as an English teacher at a school for 14 years.  Her salary is not enough for living and this is why she was accepted to the third year of the finance and credit department of the Tajikistan State Commerce University this year with a goal of obtaining a second degree and finding a suitable job with a high salary in the future in order to have enough to provide for her three children.  Her husband is a doctor and his salary is not enough to help his wife to pay for the education contract.  Farhunda came to our organization to obtain a loan.  She is requesting this loan to pay for her education contract.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her university education

loans.name: Sheke

texts.en: This is 41 year old Sheke. He is married, and has 2 children aged 6 and 9 months. In 1996, Sheke established his business selling groundnuts, dry peppers, beans, etc. He began his business because after he finished his schooling there were no jobs available. His business is located in the outskirts of town and his main customers are men and women. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about SLL 800,000 every month. Sheke now requires a new loan of SLL 3,000,000 in order to purchase sacks of groundnuts, dry peppers, and beans for resale. He hopes that this loan, used properly, will help his business. In the future, Sheke plans to erect a house on his land. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs

loans.name: Issa

texts.en: This is 43 year old Issa.  He is married and has 2 children, aged 15 and 10 years. He has 2 additional dependents, who live with him for the purposes of schooling.  In 2005, Issa established his potato, cassava, and palm oil business, which he began because he wants to take care of his family. His business is located on the outskirts of town and his main customers are women. Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, he earns about SLL 525,000 every month. Issa requires a loan of SLL 3,000,000 in order to purchase sacks of cassava, potatoes and palm oil for resale. He hopes that this loan will help him to expand by increasing his stock and earning more profits. In the future, he plans to get two plots of land and construct a two bedroom house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of cassava, potatoes and palm oil

loans.name: Mamusu

texts.en: This is 45 year old Mamusu.  She is married and has two children aged 25 and 20. She has 1 additional dependent, who lives with her for the purposes of schooling.  In 2007, Mamusu established her wood and palm oil business, which she began because she wants to assist her husband in taking care of the home. Her business is located on the outskirts of town and her main customers are women and people involved with bakeries. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about SLL 500,000 every month. Mamusu requires a loan of SLL 3,000,000 in order to purchase 400 piles of wood and 50 rubbers of palm-oil for resale. She hopes that this loan will help her to meet the demand of her customers. In the future, Mamusu plans to finish her house in Rokel village and to become a supplier of wood. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and palm oil

loans.name: Sinneh

texts.en: This is 42 years old Sinneh.  He is married and has 2 children aged 6 months and 8 years. In 2002, Sinneh established his charcoal and palm oil business, which he inherited from his late mother. It is located on the outskirts of town and his main customers are women. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 800,000 every month. Sinneh requires a loan of SLL 3,000,000 in order to purchase sacks of charcoal and rubbers of palm oil for resale. He hopes that this loan will help him to earn more profits. In the future, Sinneh plans to complete his house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: This is 51 year old Fatmata.  She is married and has 4 children aged 32, 30, 28 and 22 years. In 2006, she established her baby clothing business, which she began because she wants to help her husband with some responsibilities. Her business is located close to a children’s hospital in the outskirts of town and her main customers are pregnant women and suckling mothers. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 700,000 every month. Fatmata requires a loan of SLL 3,000,000 in order to buy more diapers, baby oil, baby powder and napkins for resale. She hopes that this loan will help her to meet the demand of her customers. She plans to develop and build her own shop, and to educate her children up to a university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more baby items

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 56 years old and a widow with four children.

Estela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell, such as soap, shampoo, canned goods and soft drinks.

Estela has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from tailoring.

Estela aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods and soft drinks

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from buying and selling dried fish.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Frediswinda

texts.en:
Frediswinda is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy items, such as shampoo, eggs, canned goods and soft drinks, to sell in her general store.

Frediswinda has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from raising chickens and buying and selling dry goods.

Frediswinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, eggs, canned goods and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Camra

texts.en:
Camra is 47 years old and has six children. She is married, and four of her children attend school.

Camra is in the agricultural business, farming and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional vegetable seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

Camra has been farming and selling vegetables for 12 years; she has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Camra would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetable seeds and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Jumda

texts.en:
Jumda is 37 years old and married with four children.

Jumda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell in her general store, like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, etc..

Jumda has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years; she also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear. and dried coconut meat.

Jumda aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell in her general store, like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 10 years, she has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines. Lolita has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell. In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Lucel

texts.en:
Lucel, 30 years old, is married and she works hard to provide for her family. For the past 2 years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. Lucel earns additional income from pig fattening.

Lucel has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, toothpaste, canned goods, noodles, sugar, etc. to sell. She has previously borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF. Lucel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, toothpaste, canned goods, noodles, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy, 47 years old, is married and has four children. Lucy has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from an automotive shop. Lucy is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Lita

texts.en:
Ma. Lita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a fishing business in the Philippines for 15 years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

Ma. Lita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional equipment for her fishing business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Ma. Lita dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment for her fishing business

loans.name: Titty

texts.en: This is 36 year old Titty. She is married and has 2 children aged  16 and 3 years. In 2006, she established her drinks and cosmetics business, which she began because she wants to develop herself and her family. Her business is located in the outskirts of town and her main customers are women and men. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 700,000 every month. Titty requires a loan of SLL 3,000,000 in order to purchase soft drinks, pure drinking water, perming cream, and weaving hair for resale. She hopes that this loan, used properly, will help her to develop her business. In the future, Titty plans to become an international business woman, build her own house and give a quality education to her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and drinks

loans.name: Lodrina

texts.en:
Lodrina is 58 years old, a widow with 10 children.

Lodrina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a ambulant vending business (moves from place to place) of dried fish in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell.

Lodrina has borrowed, and repaid, 21 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the ambulant vending of dried fish for 15 years, and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Lodrina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa has operated a fishing business in the Philippines for 5 years. She works hard to support her three children, all attending school. Marissa has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets and other equipment for her business. In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets and other equipment for her business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a hardworking entrepreneur. She has operated a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines for 5 years and earns additional income from fishing. Mary Ann is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 2 years, she has operated a water distribution business in the Philippines. Merlita has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase other equipment for her business. In the future, Merlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase other equipment for her business

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en: Nieves, 48 years old, is married and has nine children. She has been farming rice for 27 years and also earns additional income from a general store. Nieves is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm equipment. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm equipment

loans.name: Norol

texts.en: Norol, 49 years old, is widowed and has 8 children, four of them in school. She has been farming rice for 8 years and has previously borrowed 11 times from NWTF to sustain her business. Norol has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets and other equipment for her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. Rosalinda hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets and other equipment for her business

loans.name: Tinocra

texts.en:
Tinocra is 31 years old; she is married with one child.

Tinocra works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store, like canned goods, snack foods, eggs, etc..

Tinocra has borrowed, and repaid, 19 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years, and also earns an income from buying and selling dried coconut meat.

Tinocra aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store, like canned goods, snack foods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Almakul

texts.ru: Алмакул 51 лет, мать 4 детей. Алмакул в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1992 года занимается торговлей продуктами питания в своем селе Ат-Башы, начав этот бизнес с 1,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Алмакул, ее деятельность приносит около 25,000 сом в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Благодаря тому, что Алмакул очень общительная и добрая женщина клиенты магазина  очень её любят, и очень хорошо отзываются о ней. Доходы от бизнеса позволили Алмакул дать образование своим детям. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алмакул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товара оборота в магазине. Доходы от кредита Алмакул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, часть доходов планирует копить на обучение детей.
texts.en: Almakul is 51 years old and a mother of four children.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, she has been involved in selling food products in her At-Bashy village since 1992, having started this business with a sum of 1,000 som.  Thanks to Almakul's hard work, her business yields about 25,000 som per month, which serves as the foundation for covering expenses for food and consumer needs of the family.  Thanks to the fact that Almakul is a very communicative and kind woman, her store customers love her very much and have very positive feedback about her.  The income from the business allowed Almakul to provide education for her children.  In order to further develop her business, Almakul requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to increase goods turnover at the store.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into developing her business further and use some of the income to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to increase goods turnover at the store

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en: This is 58 year old Alpha.  He is married, and has 5 children aged 30, 28, 25, 17 and 15. In 1982, Alpha established his cassava, potato and Chinese yam business, which he began because he wants to assist himself and family. His business is located in the outskirts of town and his main customers are women. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 500,000 every month. Alpha now requires a new loan of SLL 3,000,000 in order to purchase sacks of cassava, potatoes, etc., for resale. He hopes that this loan will help him to realize more profits. In the future, he plans to finish his three-story building and put it up for rent. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of potatoes, cassava, yams and garri

loans.name: Abdul Rahim

texts.en:
This is 40 year-old Abdul.  He is married and has four children aged two, five, eight and fourteen. He has one additional dependent who lives with him in order to help a sister with her child's education.  

In 2007, Abdul established his used clothing business. He began his business because he wants to be self-reliant after coming from the mines. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are adults, especially ladies. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, he earns about Le 1,980,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Abdul has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy a bale of ladies' blouses. He hopes that this loan will improve his stock and add to his profits. In the future, Abdul plans to open an outlet at the outskirt of town. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for used clothing.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
This is 35 year-old Emmanuel.  He is married and has no children. 

In 2005, Emmanuel established his ready-made clothes, baby clothing and calculators business. He began his business because he wants to be self-reliant after coming from the village. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,289,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000.  Emmanuel has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and he now requires a new loan in order to buy jeans, T-shirt and shirts. He hopes that this loan will improve his stock and increase his profit. In the future, Emmanuel plans to improve his business and use the proceeds of the loan to begin constructing a house on land he just acquired. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for jeans, t-shirt and shirts.

loans.name: Amy Fe

texts.en:
Amy Fe is 49 years old, is married and has five children.

Amy Fe works hard to provide for her family. She sells beauty products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more beauty products to sell.

Amy Fe has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been selling beauty products for four years and also earns income from buying and selling charcoal and farming sugarcane.

Amy Fe aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products to resell.

loans.name: Divinagracia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Divinagracia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Divinagracia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store, such as canned goods, eggs, noodles and soap.

Divinagracia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, and soap.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food preparation and vending business in the Philippines.

Anabel requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for five years.

Anabel would like to save money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 36 years old, married, and has four children, who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Evelyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF, to purchase materials for her fishing boat. Evelyn has been in the fishing business for 10 years. 

Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her fishing boat

loans.name: Flores Marie

texts.en:
Flores Marie is 27 years old, married, and has three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Flores Marie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF, to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for two years, and also earns income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream -- to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Leona

texts.en:
Leona is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a general store business in the Philippines for 3 years. She earns additional income from farming rice, raising pigs and retailing rice. Leona is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to buy additional items such as canned goods, snack foods, eggs, soft drinks, etc. to sell in her store.

Leona has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as canned goods, snack foods, eggs, soft drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia, 59 years old, is married and has 3 children. She works very hard to provide for them. Lucia has run a general store in the Philippines for 19 years. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as canned goods, spices, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell. In the future, Lucia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, spices, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Replita

texts.en:
Replita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business farming and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years and earns additional income from selling food. Replita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Replita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda, 48 years old, is married and has one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for her family. Yolanda has run a general store in the Philippines for 15 years. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock such as soft drinks, bread, eggs, soap, shampoo, spices, etc. to sell. In the future, Yolanda would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as soft drinks, bread, eggs, soap, shampoo, spices, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгуль 32 лет, незамужем. Воспитывает одного ребенка. Основная деятельность семьи Айгуль – это откорм и перепродажа скота. Начатое 2003 году со стартовой суммой в 20,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство сегодня приносит около 3,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В данный момент, в хозяйстве Айгуль имеется одна дойная корова и три барана и 5 коз. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Айгуль обратилась в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота. Это позволит ей увеличить своей хозяйство и приумножить поголовье скота, сделав, таким образом по ее мнению, наилучшее капиталовложение. Мечтает купить квартиру.
texts.en: Aigul is 32 years old and unmarried. She is raising one child. The primary business of Aigul's family is the fattening up and resale of cattle. Beginning in 2003 with the initial amount of 20,000 Kyrgyz Som, her agricultural business now brings in about 3,000 Kyrgyz Som per month. Currently, Aigul has one milk cow, three sheep and five goats in her stock. For the future expansion of her herd, Aigul turned to the Company "Bai Tushum and Partners" to request a loan in the amount of 80,000 Kyrgyz Som for the purchase of additional livestock. This would allow her to expand her agricultural business and increase her number of livestock. In her opinion, doing this is the very best kind of investment. She dreams of buying an apartment.

loans.use: To purchase 3 bulls

loans.name: Iris Suyapa

texts.es: Iris, tiene 32 años de edad, vive con su esposo en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Ella lleva 10 años de haber establecido su propio negocio de elaboración de piñatas para toda ocasión y variedad de diseños.
