Este producto lo vende por encargos en las tiendas, supermercados y mercados de la ciudad. Anteriormente trabajaba en maquila pero decidió con su esposo dedicarse a la fabricación de piñatas. Ella ha solicitado un préstamo por 10,000 lempiras para la compra de materiales como ser papel china, maskin tape pegamento y alambre para sacar los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes. Ella esta positiva con su negocio ya que las piñatas que hace son muy bonitas y tienen gran demanda. Su plan es hacerle mejoras al negocio y hacerlo crecer más.
texts.en:
Iris is 32 years old and lives with her husband in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula. For 10 years, she has been established in her own business making piñatas for every occasion and in a variety of designs. She sells this product through orders at the stores, supermarkets and markets of the city. 

Previously she worked in a factory. but she and her husband decided to devote themselves to making piñatas. She has applied for a loan of 10,000 lempiras to buy materials such as tissue paper, masking tape, glue and wire to fill the orders she has from her customers. 

She is positive about her business, since the piñatas she makes are very beautiful and are in great demand. Her plan is to make improvements to her business and make it grow.

loans.use: To buy materials such as paper, glue, wire and masking tape for making  piñatas.

loans.name: Patrocenia

texts.en:
Patrocenia is 59 years old, is married and has five children.

Patrocenia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 60,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell, such as soap, bread, biscuits and canned goods.

Patrocenia has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 25 years and also earns income from selling vegetables and raising pigs.

Patrocenia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell such as soap, bread, biscuits and canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer, for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Abakhalabani Group

texts.en:
Jacktone is a member of Abakhalabani Group in Busia District. He is pictured with 20 One Acre Fund farmers, 10 women and 10 men.  Jacktone is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He is receiving a loan for farm inputs to cultivate ½ acre of maize and sorghum. Jacktone is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited about the 2013 Long Rains season.  He joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seeds and fertilizer and to rest assured of reliable input delivery, to grow enough food for the family and ro use increased profits to send his children to school.

Jacktone described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one as a One Acre Fund farmer. He plans to spend the money that he earns from his next harvest on sending his children to school, repairing his home, buying livestock and perhaps investing in another business. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive agricultural inputs on credit for ½  acre. Jacktone’s group will receive 10 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Oktyabr

texts.ru: Октябрь 51 лет, вдова, дети Октябрь уже взрослые и самостоятельные. Октябрь имеет высшее образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы соседей. Они отзываются о ней как о доброй и трудолюбивой женщине.  Октябрь в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2000 года занимается животноводством , начав этот бизнес с 8,000 KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Октябрь в хозяйстве имеется 4 коровы, 20 голов овец, 20 голов коз и 1 лошадь, ее деятельность приносит около  12,000 KGS в месяц,от продажи молока и молочной продукции, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи.По мимо продажи молока Октябрь занимается откормом скота и перепродажей.  Доходы от бизнеса позволили Октябрь женить своих детей и обустроить их. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Октябрь обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков и овец, так как  цены на скот очень низкие. Доходы от кредита Октябрь планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, и весной хочет сделать ремонт дома
texts.en: Oktyabr is 51 years old, a widow, and her children are already grown and independent.  Oktyabr has a higher education and has very good feedback from her neighbors.  They say that she is a kind and hardworking woman.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry since 2000, having started this business with a sum of 8,000 KGS.  Thanks to Oktyabr's hard work, her business contains four cows, 20 sheep, 20 goats and one horse, and yields about 12,000 KGS per month from sales of milk and dairy products, which serves as the foundation for covering expenses for food and consumer needs of the family.  Besides selling milk, she is involved in feeding and reselling livestock.  The income from the business allowed Oktyabr to marry off and provide for her children.  In order to further develop her business, Oktyabr requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy bulls and sheep because livestock prices are very low.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further expanding her business and wants to make housing repairs at home.

loans.use: to buy bulls and sheep

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: This is 56 year old Hawa.  She is a widow and has 1 child aged 33 years. She has 2 additional dependents, who live with her for the purposes of schooling.  In 1987, she established her business  selling garri, beans, groundnuts and rice. She began her business because she wants to assist in taking care of the home. Her business is located in the outskirts of town and her main customers are women. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 600,000 every month. Hawa requires a loan SLL 3,000,000 in order to purchase sacks of beans, rice, etc. for resale. She hopes that this loan will help her to purchase more of her business items. In the future, Hawa plans to erect a one-flat building at Rokel and on her two plots of land at Simma town. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bags of groundnuts, beans, garri, rice, etc.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 69 years old, is married and has four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Linda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials to repair her fishing boat.

Linda has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Linda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a hardworking entrepreneur who sells clothes in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to purchase more clothes to resell.

Regina has been in this business for five years. Regina earns additional income from direct selling.

Regina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Tuinuke Group

texts.en:
Mulwanda is a group of 16 farmers in Butere District represented by Prisca. The group has 15 women and one man.  Prisca is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant a half acre of maize and sorghum.

Prisca first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Prisca joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed their family, to have additional maize profit to send their children to school and to access fertilizers and hybrid seed. 

Prisca reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about four bags of maize per three-quarters acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 14 1/2 bags per three-quarters acre. She plans to spend the money that she earns from her next harvest on sending her children to school, buying livestock, and perhaps investing in another business. 

Prisca's group members will each receive input loans of 1/2 acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for eight acres of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Jameel

texts.en:
Jameel is a 38-year-old married man who has five children and lives in Sana`a, Yemen.

He is a teacher who offers education careers for students. He is helpful and works hard to be a success in his life. He gets a low salary that isn't enough to buy for home appliances, so he applied for a loan from AMB to buy furniture for his house.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Kamla

texts.en:
Kamla is an older woman from the Negev. Her children are grown. She has run a household goods store on the first floor of her home for the last year. Kamla decided to open her store when she could not finish the month on her pension payment. The small amount she receives each month simply does not cover her expenses. As a strong, determined women, she decided to develop her micro-enterprise.

Kamla needed this loan to purchase stock and pay for renovating the flooring at her store’s entrance.

Kamla wants to continue and manage her store well and assist her daughters with their children. In the future, she wants to introduce electronic items into the store.

loans.use: to purchase stock and pay for renovating the flooring at her store’s entrance.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 34 years old, a married man, and has five children. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has obtained a bachelor's degree, and he is a teacher. 

He is requesting a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy furniture. He thinks this loan will help him to improve his living comfort.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house

loans.name: Chimedtseye

texts.en:
Mrs. Chimedtseye is 57 years old and lives with her husband in a small house, in Hentii province of Mongolia. Her children have all gotten married and live separately now. Her husband, Erdene-Ochir, helps his wife run her business of organic fruit juice production and sales. He delivers organic juice to his wife's customers. 

Chimedtseye has been producing organic fruit juice, dairy juice and birch juice since 2011. She supplies her organic juice products to local primary schools and other customers in the local market. She is requesting a 3,400,000 MNT loan. She will use the loan to purchase organic fruits and milk, to produce more organic juice and increase her income. She is a hard-working, diligent, and well-behaved woman.

loans.use: to purchase more organic fruit and milk, so she can increase her income by making more organic juice drinks.

loans.name: Asmahan

texts.en:
Asmahan, 34, is a conservative woman, so she asked her husband, Ishaq, to take her place in the photo. She is a mother of four sons and a daughter. 

Her husband has a supermarket from which they get their family income. Asmahan wants to support her husband and add more shelves with a new variety of goods to the store. For that she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to add more shelves with a new variety of goods.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 47-year-old married woman. With her lives her 13-year-old son. 

Khadija works in a school as a school maid. Besides her day job, Khadija also has a home-based business selling clothes. 

She has applied for this loan in order to get a new winter collection of clothes that fit different ages.

loans.use: to get a new winter collection of clothes

loans.name: Dolgorjav

texts.en: Mrs. Dorgorjav is 38 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in a small house in the Selenge province of Mongolia. Her husband Battulga, age 30, is a plumber and works on orders from customers. Her son Sanchir-Erdene and daughter Nomin-Erdene both go to a local secondary school. She has been working as a hairdresser since 1993. She started her own barbershop in February 2012 with a public shower room in town. She rents a place, and the place needs some renovation and a new heating system installed in order to lower the heat loss and to provide the local customers with better service. She is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase a new heating system to install in her workplace, a barbershop and public shower place. She is a hardworking, responsible and organized person.

loans.use: To purchase a new heating system to install in her workplace, a barbershop and public shower place

loans.name: Wesal

texts.en:
Wesal is a 50-year-old housewife. She has six sons and two daughters. Her youngest is 25 years old. 

Wesal had to add another source of income besides her husband's retirement salary, so she started a while ago to sell blankets at home. Now Wesal wants to add selling clothing items too, to increase her profits. For that she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Munhbayar

texts.en:
Munhbayar is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in a small house in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife, Monhtsetseg, 30, helps him to work at a construction company during summers. His daughter Hishigzaya, age 9, goes to local primary school, and Egchiglen, age 4, goes to local kindergarten. 

He works at a construction company during summers and provides taxi service during winter to local customers. His car has broken down and he is planning to purchase another second-hand car that is an eco-friendly electric and gas-consuming hybrid car to provide taxi service without problems. 

He is now asking 5,000,000 MNT to purchase the eco-friendly electric and gas-consuming car for his taxi service business. He is a hardworking, positive and responsible man who also has good record on previous loans from XacBank.

loans.use: To purchase an eco-friendly car.

loans.name: Kayragul

texts.ru: Кайрагул 51 год, замужем,мать 3 детей. За период оформления кредита Кайрагул показала себя как человек ответственные, порядочный, добросовестный, предприимчивый и с чувством долга умеющий правильно вести и вкладывать денежные средства в нужное направление. Кайрагул в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1992 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 100,000 KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кайрагул, ее деятельность приносит около 15,000 KGS в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Также Кайрагул возделывает 1,80 га земли с пшеницей, фасолью, овощами и многолетними травами. за это время у неё очень развитое хозяйство, в хозяйстве имеется 6 голов коров,25 овец, 55 коз. Доходы от бизнеса позволили Кайрагул дать образование своим детям. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кайрагул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков и овец. Доходы от кредита Кайрагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, часть доходов планирует копить на обучение сына в Бишкеке и мечтает купить дом для сына в Бишкеке.
texts.en: Kayragul is 51 years old, married and a mother of three children.  Throughout the period of getting the loan, she showed herself as a responsible, decent, conscientious and entrepreneurial person with a sense of duty and knowing how to correctly direct and invest monetary means to the needed purpose.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, Kayragul has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 1992, having started this business with a sum of 100,000 KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, her business yields about 15,000 KGS per month, which serves as the foundation for covering expenses for food and consumer needs of the family.  Kayragul also works on 1.80 hectares of land with wheat, beans, vegetables and perennial herbs.  At this time, she has a very developed business that contains six cows, 25 sheep and 55 goats.  The income from the business allowed Kayragul to provide education for her children.  In order to further develop her business, Kayragul requested a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy bulls and sheep.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her business and to save some of the income for her son's education in Bishkek and dreams of buying a house for her son in Bishkek.

loans.use: to buy bulls and sheep

loans.name: Jenishgul

texts.ru: Женишгул 47 лет, вдова. После смерти мужа Женишгул осталась одна с 4 детьми. Дети является надежной опорой для матери.В период перестройки Женишгул работала воспитательницей в детском саде. После развала СССР и начала новой жизни, где каждый сам за себя. Они с Мужем начали заниматься   животноводством и полеводством.  Начатое со стартовой суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство на сегодня приносит от 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока, молочных продуктов и перепродажи скота. После смерти мужа она осталась одна, но к счастью сыновья помогают ей, и они все месте продолжают начатое дело. На данный момент в хозяйстве Женишгул имеется одна дойная корова и 3 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Женишгул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 5 бычков для откорма. После откорма она сможет реализовать их на местном рынке. Доходы Женишгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота и она мечтает построить дом для сына.
texts.en: Jenishgul is 47 years old, a widow.  After her husband's death, she was left alone with four children.  The children are a reliable source of support for the mother.  During the time of the perestroika, Jenishgul worked as a kindergarten teacher.  After the breakup of the USSR and beginning of a new life, where each person is out for themselves, Jenishgul and her husband became involved in animal husbandry and farming.  The business, started with an initial sum of 15,000 som (KGS), today yields from 10,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk, dairy products and sales of livestock.  After her husband's death, she was left alone, but luckily her sons help her, and together they continue this business.  At the present time, Jenishgul's business has one dairy cow and three sheep.  In order to further develop her business, Jenishgul requested a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy five bulls for fattening up.  After fattening them up, she would be able to sell them at a local market.  She plans to invest the earnings into further growing her livestock headcount and dreams of building a house for her son.

loans.use: to buy five bulls for fattening up

loans.name: Digna Marizol

texts.es: Digna tiene 30 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio de la Masica, Atlántida. Ella se ha dedicado a realizar labores del hogar, pero hace un año decidió por establecer su propio negocio de una pulpería para vender productos de la canasta básica familiar como harina, arroz, frijoles, carnes, sal, pan, manteca, azúcar, productos de aseo, papel higiénico, huevos, pastillas, salsas,  etc. con el préstamo que ha solicitado por 8,000 Lempiras lo utilizara para surtir mas el negocio, quiere mantener mas inventario de productos como granos básicos, carnes, lácteos, azúcar y otros para vender e incrementar las ganancias. Su meta es tener siempre el negocio para obtener ingresos para que su hijo se gradúe.
texts.en:
Digna is 30 years old, married, and has a son. She lives in the municipality of La Masica, Atlantida. She has been doing her household chores, but a year ago decided to set up her own general store business to sell basic household necessities such as flour, rice, beans, meats, salt, bread, lard, sugar, hygiene products, toilet paper, eggs, pills, sauces, etc. 

With the loan she has applied for of 8,000 lempiras, she will further stock her store. She wants to keep a larger inventory of products such as basic staples, meat, dairy products, sugar and other items to sell and increase her earnings. Her goal is to always have the store to get income so that her son  can graduate.

loans.use: To buy food products to sell, such as meats, beans, rice, sugar, dairy products and others items for supplying her small general store.

loans.name: Chuluun

texts.en:
Mr. Chuluun is 68 years old and lives with his wife, in an apartment in Orhon province of Mongolia. His wife, Oyuntuya, age 68, helps her husband to run his business, which includes retail sale of house plants and a photo studio. Their children have all married and moved out of their parents' house. 

Chuluun has been running his business, growing and selling of house plants, since 2001. He rents a place for running this business, and his workplace needs renovation in order for his business to operate without any problems. He is now requesting a 3,000,000MNT loan, to purchase construction materials and other necessary items for renovation of his workplace. He is a hard-working, friendly and communicative person.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials and other necessary items for renovation of his workplace

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 52-year-old housewife living with her husband and son. 

Sarah has a tiny market from where she sells snacks and some food products. With her smile she welcomes her customers in her tiny shop.

Now she has applied for this loan to bring in more food products, and in the future she would like to expand the shop or move to another bigger place.

loans.use: to bring in more food products.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 44-year-old mother of three daughters and one son. Her husband is in a wholesale business that helps her in getting the products and goods for her business at a good price. Siham sells food products and mostly canned ones. 

She applied for this loan to bring in more food products to increase her revenue.

loans.use: to bring in more food products.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
To help improve their living conditions, Sahar had a small home business selling accessories and embroidered items 25 years ago. Almost five years ago she opened her own shop and expanded her business. She applied for this loan today to increase the quantity of accessories she has and to add hanging accessories used in house entrances.

Sahar is a conservative woman; she asked her daughter Maram to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of accessories she has for sale.

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en: Sameera is a 31-year-old married woman whose husband is a butcher. She has a sewing and tailoring home business that she wants to improve. She applied for this loan to buy more threads and fabric to make more clothing items. In the future she plans to open her own tailoring workshop.

loans.use: to buy more threads and fabric to make more clothing items.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en: Sharifa is a 46-year-old widow, who is supporting her 8 sons and daughters. Two of them are now married. Sharifa works in the archiving department at a school. After work she makes baskets and trays using hay. Although one of her sons is now helping in supporting the family from his work with the military, Sharifa still needs to work to help support the family. She now wants to buy some wool and start knitting clothes for the coming winter, and she will keep on making the hay crafts. For these reasons, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more materials to produce goods to sell, such as hay crafts and knitted clothing

loans.name: Davaahuu

texts.en:
Davaahuu is a 47-year-old widow who lives with her daughter in a ger (a traditional nomadic yurt) in the Hovd province of Mongolia. Her daughter, Haliunaa, is 16 years old and goes to the local secondary school. 

She has been operating various kinds of businesses for years. She is well known among both customers and other businesses within the area. She has started providing taxi services within the area and also works as a retailer of pelts and hides in the local market. 

She is now requesting 4,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of livestock hides and supply them to a local manufacturer in order to increase her income. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "My daughter is going to enter university very soon and I need to save for her education expense."

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of livestock hides and supply them to a local manufacturer in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Delgermoron

texts.en: Mrs. Delgermoron is a 35-year-old, divorced woman, who lives with her son in a rental apartment in Arkhangai province of Mongolia. Her son, Monhbayar, age 10, goes to a local school. She has been working as a saleswoman at a rental counter of the local market since 2004. She is now starting her own business, selling second-hand shoes at retail in a local market. She is requesting a loan of 450,000 MNT to purchase second-hand shoes from wholesalers. She is a friendly, welcoming and hard-working woman.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand shoes from wholesalers

loans.name: Doloonjin

texts.en: Mrs. Doloonjin is 38 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in a small house in the Selenge province of Mongolia. Her husband Tsogbadrah, 38, is a firefighter at the local fire department. Her twin sons Bathuu and Bat-Erdene are 17 years old and go to the local secondary school, and her daughter Tergel is 2 years old and goes to the local kindergarten. She has been working as a saleswoman in a local market since 2003. She has gained a lot of experience over the years, and she is now planning to start her own clothing retail business in the market. She is now requesting 1,300,000 MNT to purchase a starting inventory for her newly started clothing retail business. She is a hardworking, responsible and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for her newly started clothing retail business

loans.name: Enhbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Enhbaatar is 28 years old and lives with his wife and son in Ger in the Hentii province of Mongolia. His wife Enhtuya, 24, works as an accountant at a private company. His son Uuganbayar, 3, goes to a local kindergarten. Mr. Enhbaatar has been driving a truck and working at a local private coal mining company since 2010. He has temporarily stopped his business because his truck needs to be fixed and some of the parts need to be replaced. He is now requesting 1,850,000 MNT to purchase wheels and to get his car fixed in order to run his transportation business smoothly and without problems. He is a hardworking, well-behaved and responsible person.

loans.use: to purchase wheels and get his car fixed in order to run his transportation business smoothly and without problems

loans.name: Abdulmeneim

texts.en:
Abdulmeneim is a 19-year-old single guy. He has three sisters.
 
Abdulmeneim is a university student majoring in law. He has applied for this loan to help him to pay his next semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for his next semester fees

loans.name: Tunamerimwe Group

texts.fr:
Fulgence fait partie du groupe Tunamerimwe  et   habite à Gitega. Il a   34 ans et est marié à Karirekinyana, une commerçante de charbon. Ensemble ils ont  1 enfant de 15 ans ,qui étudie.
Il a sous sa charge 2 enfants de la famille élargie.

Il  fait le commerce de  charbon de bois  depuis 10 ans. 

Il  est à son  quatorzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de sacs de charbon de bois  à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Les gains de son commerce, lui permettent  de faire vivre sa famille.
texts.en:
Fulgence belongs to the "Tunamerimwe" group and lives in Gitega. He is 34 years old and married to Karirekinyana, a charcoal merchant. Together, they have one child, aged 15, who is in school.

He has two children from his extended family in his care.

He has run a business selling charcoal for ten years.

He is on his 14th loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan he obtains, he is going to increase his capital and buy multiple bags of charcoal for resale, in order to earn more.

The profit from his business allows him to provide for his family.

loans.use: To increase his capital and buy multiple bags of charcoal for resale, in order to earn more.

loans.name: Sao I.

texts.en:
This is 40 year-old Sao.  She is married and has four children aged three, five, eight and fourteen; three are attending school. She has one additional dependent who lives with her to assist an in-law with her child's education.

In 2007, Sao established her used clothing business. She began her business to assist her husband in maintaining their home. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are women.  Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about Le 1,821,000 every month from her business.

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Sao has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy women's clothing. She hopes that this loan will improve her stock increase her profit. In the future, Sao plans to open an outlet for her younger brother in the central market. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sabha

texts.en: Sabha, a 53-year-old illiterate woman, has five sons, two of whom are married, and two daughters. Sabha has recently started a small home business selling second hand children's clothes which she buys at a cheap price. She applied for this loan to buy more winter clothes to sell to increase her revenue.

loans.use: to buy more second hand children's winter clothes to resell.

loans.name: Delgertsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Delgertsetseg is a 34-year-old widow, who lives with her two children, in a ger in the Bayahoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her son Dalaitseren, age 14, goes to a local secondary school, and her younger son Yavuuhai, age 2, goes to kindergarten. 

Delgertsetseg has attended a tailoring course provided by a local NGO, and now is planning to open her own tailoring service business, in a local market. She is requesting a loan of 600,000 MNT to purchase inventory with which to start her own tailoring service business. She is a hard-working, positive, and responsible woman, who says, "I am the only one who takes care of my sons, and I will try my best to make a brighter future for them."

loans.use: to purchase inventory to start her own business of tailoring service in a local market

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmed is 25 years old and is from Sana`a, Yemen. He is married and has three children. He has a taxi business, which he wishes to improve for his family's pleasant life. He is a hard-working man. He saved up money to buy his taxi, which he uses to get daily income for his family. He is asking for a loan of 100,000 YER to buy spare parts for his taxi.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Enhbold

texts.en:
Mr. Enhbold is 41 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a small house in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife Purevdulam, 38, works as saleswoman in the local market, while his son Purevnyam, 19, is a sophomore student at university, and his daughter Namuuntsetseg goes to a local primary school. 

Neat, hardworking and welcoming, Enhbold has been operating a bicycle repair and sales business since 2001, importing bicycles and spare parts from Erlian, China. He is requesting a 4'000'000MNT loan to pay for his son's university tuition and living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for his son's university tuition and living expenses.

loans.name: Enhtsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs.Enhtsetseg, 41 years old, lives with her husband and two sons in a ger in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her husband Tomorbaatar, 35, provides a taxi service within the area, while her son Taivanbaatar, 17, studies at a local secondary school and her younger son Zolboot, 2, attends a local kindergarten.

Enhtsetseg has been working as an interior designer for years, but because it is seasonal work she is now planning to start a taxi service. She is requesting a loan of 2'000'000MNT to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas car to provide the service.

A clever, hardworking and responsible woman, Enhtsetseg says, "I cannot stay home during winter from now on. Next year my son will be a university student and we need to save for his education costs from now on."

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas car to provide taxi service.

loans.name: Hosea

texts.en: Hosea is a 38-year-old, married man with five children living in Kagadi, Uganda.  He is a teacher who was inspired into that profession by the urge to inspire young people.  He also owns a coffee plantation which he runs to supplement his low salary.  He wishes to educate his children at the university level and to build a permanent house since they are currently renting.  His business plan is to expand his coffee plantation by buying more land.  Hosea is requesting for a loan to buy iron sheets for roofing his house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets for roofing his house.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 34-year-old, hardworking man living in Kagadi, Uganda.  He is a teacher who also operates a retail shop to supplement his low salary.  He desires to educate his children up to the university level and to build a permanent residential house, as they are currently living under a mud-walled house.  His business goal is to have a wholesale shop.  Joseph intends to use the loan to buy iron sheets to roof his residential house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets to roof his residential house.

loans.name: Bshar Group

texts.en: This group is called Bshar, and it is comprised of four women and one man, who live in Taiz, Yemen. Eftkar is a 32-year-old, married woman. She owns a house. She applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB, to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.name: Al-Yasmin Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Yasmin, and it is comprised of four ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen.

Amal is 28 years old and married. She owns a house and intends to renew her house. She applied for a Youth Loan of 40,000 YER from AMB, to buy construction supplies for her home.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her home

loans.name: Ummi

texts.en:
Ummi lives in Mombasa area of Coast province. She is a mother of two school children. She operates a hawking business which has been in operation for three years now. She started the business through her own little savings. In this business she sells clothes, sanitary pads etc.
She learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of the business. The challenges she is facing are seasonal business climate, high cost of purchasing stock and finding customers. 
Ummi is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy additional stock of second hand clothes. Her extra income from the loan will be added to savings to expand her business and for personal use. Her future plan is to buy a public service vehicle.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon lives in Changamwe area of Coast province, Kenya. He is a married father of four children and owns a green grocery stall which he has been operating for two years. In this business, Simon sells greens, fruits, vegetables, cereals etc. He began the business through the capital he raised from the casual jobs he once performed.
Simon learnt about Milango through a friend and joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenges he is facing are bad debts and high cost of transport.
Simon is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy a piece of land to build a rental house. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to expand the business. His plans for the future are to start other businesses and also open stalls in different areas.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land to build a rental house.

loans.name: Davaatseren

texts.en: Davaatseren is 57 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a small house in the Niseh district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His 43-year-old wife, Zayabat, works at a local hospital as a nurse. One of his children, 18-year-old Temuulen, just enrolled in university, whlie his other child, 12-year-old Tsolmon, attends local school. He has been driving a big truck for 12 years and has become well-known for providing transportation services within the area. He is hardworking, welcoming and communicative. He is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to cover his older child's university tuition fee and other expenses.

loans.use: to cover his older child's university tuition fee and other expenses.

loans.name: Erdenebaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Erdenebaatar is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a rental apartment in the Orhon Province of Mongolia. His wife, Nandinjargal, 25, is a Masters student and temporarily stays home because she just gave birth to their son, Irmuun, 7 months ago. His daughter Misheel, age of 4, goes to a local kindergarten. 

Erdenebaatar has been running a mobile phone repair business since 2008. He is now planning to expand his business and start selling mobile phones at his rental counter in a local shopping center. 

He is now requesting 3,500,000 MNT to purchase more inventory, so he can run his business with a higher income. 

He is a well-communicative, friendly and hardworking man.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory so he can run his business with a higher income.

loans.name: Georgestan

texts.en:
A married father of five children, Georgestan, who lives in Kongowea, Kenya, is a water vendor who has been supplying his neighborhoods for 32 years; the idea for the business arose from the fact that there is a challenge of water delivery in the area. He also owns a retail shop and rental houses.

A loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings will help Georgestan buy a 24,000 litre water tank for the business, and he intends to purchase more tanks in the future and provide employment to other people. Georgestan believes the resulting additional income will improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to buy a 24,000 litre water tank for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new clothes to sell at her clothes shop.

loans.name: Musuu

texts.en:
Musuu lives in the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has four children. She owns a green grocer which she has been operating for three years. In this business, Musuu sells vegetables like tomatoes, kales, etc. She began the business from the income from a farming business.
Musuu learnt about Milango through a friend with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenges she is facing are price fluctuation and inflation, purchasing stock and seasonal business climate.
Musuu is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy vegetables wholesale. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to purchase a piece of land and build a residential house in addition to helping educate her children.

loans.use: to buy vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Azam

texts.en:
Azam is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. He is married.  Azam is a mechanic, mainly doing welding work; a trade he has worked at for four years.
He learnt of Milango from a friend and joined in order to access funds. He is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase additional spare parts and plates for welding work.
The only challenge in the business is the high cost of spare parts, but Azam is determined to carry out his operations well because he believes that it is from such a venture that he can establish his family. His future ambition is to be able to open another new branch for mechanical work.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts and plates for welding work.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has seen some growth in his business. He was able to construct the house and pay his children's school fees. His plan at the moment is to build business premises for his boutique. He believes this will help him better provide for his family.

David is applying for a loan of 83,450 Kenyan shillings to build business premises.

loans.use: To build business premises for his boutique.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stocks of cosmetics and hair food along with a television.

loans.name: Rogelio Abigail

texts.es: Rogelio de 24 años de edad vive con su esposa de 22 años de edad y su pequeño. Es un hombre muy trabajador ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por dar y brindar lo mejor para su familia, es honesto, sincero que su mayor sueño y anhelo es que su hijo siempre viva en condiciones dignas y que en su hogar nunca haga falta el pan de cada día. Actualmente se dedica a la labor de ser jornalero es decir tiene una pequeña cosecha, siembra los principales granos básicos como frijol  y maíz vende cierta parte y lo otro lo deja para su familia, es así como Rogelio se gana la vida honradamente. El siente la necesidad de mejorar un poco sus cosechas es por esa razón que solicita a INTEGRAL un préstamo para poder así comprar insumos básicos como: Fertilizantes, Pesticidas, Insecticidas, semillas, Abonos entre otros. Él sabe que con eso mejoraran sus ventas y podrá seguirle brindando un buen bienestar a su familia como lo ha hecho hasta el día de hoy.
texts.en: Rogelio is 24 years old and lives with his 22 year old wife and young son.  He is a very hardworking man known for providing the best for his family.  He is honest, sincere, and his greatest desire is to live in dignified conditions and that his household wants for nothing.  Currently he works as a laborer, in other words he has a small harvest where he raises basic grains such as beans and corn.  He sells some of his harvest and uses the rest for his family.  This is how Rogelio earns an honest living.  He feels the need to improve a bit, so he approached INTEGRAL for a loan so that he can buy basic supplies, such as fertilizer, pesticides, insecticides, seeds, compost and other things.  He knows that these things will help improve his sales and allow him to provide for his family’s wellbeing, as he has always done.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es: Félix de 48 años de edad reside junto a su esposa y sus hijos. Es un hombre visionario que lo que a él más le ha importado en la vida es dar lo mejor para sus hijos y que estos se lo agradezcan el día de mañana. Es muy trabajador se ha caracterizado por tener varias profesiones ha sido motorista, tracturador, jornalero y actualmente posee una pequeña cosecha donde cultiva arroz, frijol, maíz y elote. Buscando el bienestar de sus hijos Félix desea ampliar más su cosechas, mejorarlas y que siempre sean las preferidas por los clientes  es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL  para solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos básicos como: fertilizantes, pesticidas, semillas, abonos u otros. Siempre buscando lo mejor para su familia espera contar con la ayuda necesaria y así seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en: Félix is 48 years old and lives with his wife and children.  He is a visionary man whose main concern in life has been providing the best for his children and that they appreciate it someday.  He is hardworking and is known for having various professions, such as driver, translator, laborer, and he currently has a small harvest of rice, beans, and corn.  Félix wants to improve his children’s wellbeing by expanding his harvest and improving it so that his customers will prefer them.  For this reason he approached INTEGRAL to ask for a loan to buy basic supplies such as fertilizer, pesticides, seeds, compost, and other things.  He has always looked for ways to provide the best for his family and he is hoping for the necessary assistance so that he can continue feeding his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Moises Anibal

texts.es: Moisés de 24 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa e hija. Él se dedica a la  albañilería, pero cuando se terminan los proyectos pone todo su empeño en la agricultura ya que sus necesidades son muchas y al quedarse sin un trabajo busca como generar ingresos en el otro.  Moisés cultiva los principales granos básicos como: arroz, frijoles y maíz. Se caracteriza por ser una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y emprendedora, vive en condiciones muy humildes junto con su familia, pero esta situación no es un pretexto para levantarse cada día y continuar luchando para conseguir una mejor calidad de vida. Es por esta razón que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, pesticidas u otros. Con mucha confianza en Dios y en su trabajo espera tener una cosecha abundante, de la cual pueda vender una parte y dejar otra parte para su consumo. Con esto espera cumplir su sueño de dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Moisés is 24 years old and lives in a home of his own, along with his wife and daughter.  He works as a mason but when those projects end he puts all his effort into farming, since he has many needs and he looks for other ways to generate income when he is out of work.

Moisés grows the basic grains, rice, beans, and corn.  He is known for being hardworking, responsible, and enterprising, and lives in very humble conditions with his family, but this is no excuse for him not to rise every morning and continue working for a better quality of life.  For this reason he decided to request a loan through INTEGRAL, in order to invest in farming supplies such as compost, seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and other things.  With his faith in God, and through his work, he hopes to have an abundant harvest so he can sell part of it and keep the rest for personal consumption.  In this way he hopes to achieve his dream of giving his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгуль родилась в с. Кызыл-Туу в семье чабанов. Все детство Айгуль было связано в разведением скота, так как в сезон родители занимались выпасом 500-600 мелкого рогатого скота. Закончив курсы продавцов в столице, Айгуль начала работать продавцом в магазине. 2009 году Айгуль вышла замуж и вместе с мужем Батыром в 2010 году вернулась в родное село. В первые годы переезда семья Айгуль испытала трудности, не было возможности расширить хозяйство, устроиться на работу, но со временем они арендовали 1 га земли и занялись выращиваем картофеля. Затем, в качестве расширения бизнеса, Айгуль начала заниматься животноводством, купив корову, начала продавать молоко. Прибыль от продажи составляет на сегодняшний день около 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнес – деятельности, Айгуль обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,0000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров. Доходы Айгуль планирует вложить в увеличение поголовья скота, а в будущем – основать большую ферму.
texts.en: Aigul was born into a family of shepherds in the village of Kyzyl-Tuu. Her whole childhood was connected with raising livestock, as her parents grazed 500-600 head of sheep and goats each grazing season. When Aigul became an adult, she took a course for salespeople in the capital city and began to work as a salesclerk. In 2009, she got married, and she and her husband returned to her home village in 2010. For the first years after the family's move, Aigul experienced difficulties, there was no opportunity to expand the farm or to find employment, but in time they rented 1 hectare of land and began to grow potatoes. Later, as a means of expanding the business, Aigul got involved in animal husbandry, buying cows and selling milk. Today, her profit from milk sales is approximately 5,000 Som (KGS.) For the purpose of developing her business, Aigul has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 80,000 Som (KGS) to buy 2 cows. She plans to use the income generated by this loan to increase her livestock herd, and to get a large farm in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medical supplies for his centre.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys lives in the Kongowea area of the Coast Province of Kenya. She is married and has seven children, four of whom are in school. She owns a retail shop that she has been operating for three years in which she sells items such as paraffin, flour, and soap. Gladys started the business through her personal savings. The family also earns some income from retirement benefits.

Gladys learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group. She joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are price fluctuations and inflation. She looks forward to owning a permanent business premise in the future.

Gladys is applying for a loan of 10,700 Kenya shillings to buy additional stock of items, such as paraffin, flour and soap, to sell. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to help her pay the loan. Her future plan is to expand to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of items, such as paraffin, flour and soap, to sell.

loans.name: Kavumbi

texts.en:
Kavumbi lives in Kongowea, Kenya. She is a retail shop owner and has been running the business for the last two years. She is married and has two children. She established the first capital for the business by selling one of her cattle and adding the funds to her savings. She also owns a food café and engages in farming.

Kavumbi learned of Milango from her friends and joined the group to access more capital. She is applying for a loan of 10,700 Kenya shillings to purchase new stock of retail materials such as sugar, tea leaves and cereals. Challenges facing her business include the seasonal business climate and inflation. Her ambition is to open a larger retail store. She believes the additional income from this loan will help her pay for her children’s school fees and will also enable them to have access to better health care.

loans.use: to buy new stock of retail materials, such as sugar, tea leaves and cereals, to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase items such as paraffin, sugar and flour for resale.

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
El comité “Santa Ana” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní, están en el Cuarto siglo, trabajan en conjunto para ayudarse  y cada una de ellas saca el monto de acuerdo a la necesidad de invertir para poder ir creciendo en sus negocios.
Antonia es una de las miembros, ella trabaja de lunes a domingos en su despensa, desde muy tempranas horas, hasta muy tarde. Es una persona que se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante y dar a su familia todo lo que esta a su alcance.
Antonia solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser bebidas, leche, pan, yerba, azúcar y demás, que son los que mas salida tiene y quiere tener un buen stock de ellos.
En el grupo hay personas que las ayudan, pero que no retiran crédito, es por eso que hay catorce mujeres en la foto.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Santa Ana" is made up of a group of neighbors from the city of Santani.  They are in their 4th loan cycle, working together to help themselves.  Each of them will take a sum from this loan because they need to invest in their businesses to make them grow.

Antonia is one of the members of this group.  She works every day in her store, from the early hours of the morning until it is very late.  She is a person who exerts herself a lot so that she can get ahead and give her family everything that she possibly can.

Antonia is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for her store, such as drinks, milk, bread, yerba tea, sugar, and other of her most popular products. She wants to have a good supply of these items in stock.

In the group, there are some people who are helping the others, but who are not taking loans themselves. This is why there are 14 women in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy drinks, milk, bread, yerba tea, sugar, and other products

loans.name: Masyurianto

texts.en:
Mansyurianto, 32, is a businessman who sells timber to build a house. He has a wife and a seven-year-old child. Mansyurianto sells timber to a building materials store. Daily, he buys the timber from many villages and then sells directly to the store. To support his business, he has a car to transport the timbers.

This month he has a large order from the store and he needs more capital to buy timber. He is borrowing a loan from MUK of 5,000,000 IDR. He will use the loan to purchase many kinds of timber, such as teak woods, and also tools to cut the timber.

Mansyurianto hopes he can sell all the timber and get money from the store soon. The profit will be set aside for saving, capital and car repair.

loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: Paraiso Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité “PARAISO POTY “está en el cuarto ciclo, todas sus integrantes son muy trabajadoras y unidas. Ellas se unieron con la esperanza de ayudarse por medio del trabajo grupal, y es con esto que están saliendo adelante.
Todas las integrantes de este grupo se dedican a la cría y venta de animales de corral. Comentan que por medio del esfuerzo que hacen, pueden ayudar a sus familias y darles todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna.
Solicitan el crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, el cual es indispensable para ellas.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Paraiso Poty" is in its fourth loan cycle.  All of the members are hardworking and united.  They got together because they wanted to help themselves through their group work, and this is how they are making progress.

All of the members of this group raise and sell barnyard animals.  They comment that through their efforts, they are able to help their families and give them everything they need to have a decent life.

They are requesting a loan to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed for their animals, because this is something that is essential to their businesses.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres unidas es un excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, gracias a que la actual Tesorera Romina , contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, logró juntar a 18 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando en el 7° ciclo, trabajando en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Romina, la tesorera del grupo, cuenta que trabaja para ayudar a su familia,  se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, y con este trabajo se gana la vida. Tiene todo tipo de cosméticos, y ya se hizo de buena clientela gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos. Desea seguir creciendo y por eso es que se esfuerza para poder hacerlo.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de cosméticos, y asi seguir dando buena variedad para sus clientas.
texts.en:
Mujeres Unidas is an excellent group of women formed in the city of Itá thanks to the current treasurer, Romina, who got in touch with the counselor at her weekly meeting in the area.  Romina managed to get together 18 women who are in their seventh cycle, working together supportively within the program.

Romina, the treasurer of the group, says she works to help her family.  She makes a living selling cosmetics.  She has all types of cosmetics and she acquired good customers thanks to the good quality of her products.  She wants to continue growing, so she makes the effort to be able to do so.

She's requesting this loan to buy cosmetics and continue giving her customers a good variety.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Anyar Sari 1 Group

texts.en: With 11 members, the Anyar Sari 1 group continues to borrow a new loan from MUK, to expand their businesses. They want success, and to develop their families' welfare. Ni Wayan, has a daughter who is still in Junior High School. Ni Wayan will use the loan to buy four more piglets for fattening. Currently, she already has a sow. Cages have been prepared to accommodate the piglets to be born. She has a plan to develop a business, selling piglets. Her husband is very supportive of her efforts, since they have proven to improve the welfare of his family. Ni Wayan hopes her efforts will create a business that is growing and successful.

loans.use: to buy four more piglets to raise

loans.name: Anyar Sari 2 Group

texts.en:
Because the group member already has a sow, she went on to purchase superior-quality piglets and feed and repaired cages. This pig-raising business has been supplementing the family's income.

Ni Made used this loan to buy two superior piglets and high-quality feed so that the pigs can grow quickly. She plans to save money to develop their business. The daily needs are met by her husband. Her husband has been very supportive of the efforts made by Ni Made.

loans.use: To buy two superior piglets

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine. She previously accessed a loan of 30,000 PHP that she used to buy additional stock of RTW products and supplies for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan of 35,000 PHP to buy additional stock of RTW products like shirts for men, women and kids and blouses. She also has a plasticware business for additional income. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Josephine dreams of giving her children a good and quality education and hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of RTW products and plasticware needed in her business.

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Enhtuya is 51 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in a ger (traditional Mongolian tent) in the Uvurhangai Province of Mongolia. 

Her husband, Tserendonid, provides transportation services during the winters and taxi services during the summers. Her older daughter, Davaadonid, is 21 years old and a university student. Her younger daughter, Lhagvadolgor, is 17 years old and a secondary school student. 

Enhtuya has been providing tailoring services since 2002 at her home, and mainly tailors traditional clothes by customers' orders. She is now requesting 1,800,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of inventory to tailor traditional clothes for the Lunar New Year, which is the high season for traditional clothes demand.

She is a hardworking and highly experienced tailor woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of inventory to tailor traditional clothes for the Lunar New Year, which is the high season for traditional clothes demand.

loans.name: Saras

texts.en:
Saras (in the photo) and her husband, Nafy, are the same age, 35 years old. They have been married since 2001 and have two sons and one daughter. Two of the children are in primary school and the other one is still young. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh.

Saras sells fish that her husband catches. In addition, she operates a tailoring business, by putting together fabric swatches for a clothing manufacturer. Her husband is a fisherman. He wants to buy a new boat and boat motor, because the old one is breaking. 

Hence, Saras applies for her first Kiva loan of $1,500, to help her husband by purchasing the boat and motor he needs.

loans.use: To buy a new boat and boat motor for her husband.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food production business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

NWTF is relisting Dionesia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, mayonnaise and other ingredients.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is from Gango, Ozamis City. She is 50 years old, married and has four children. Maria raises coconut. During harvests, she will produce copra and then sell it. The coconut shells will be used in making charcoal. She has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns 8,000 PHP a month.

Maria joined GDMPC in 2010. Maria is requesting a loan of 36,500 PHP, which will be used to pay for labor employed in post-harvest handling. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by using the loan, to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for labor employed in post-harvest handling of her coconuts

loans.name: Lourdeliza

texts.en:
This is Lourdeliza. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She is requesting another 20,000 PHP loan, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products, to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. She also sells school and office supplies, for additional income. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lourdeliza hopes to give her child a good life and education, through all her hard work on her business. In addition, she dreams of expanding her business and being able to help others. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

NWTF is relisting Charlene's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Dwi Rahayu 1 Group

texts.en:
Dwi Rahayu 1 group got a loan for the third time. There are nine group members, and the total loan amount is 31.5 Million IDR. One of the members resigned from the group, because she had enough profit from the last loan and decided to run the business by herself. 

Having been successful at her pig fattening activity, Ni Made will use part of this new loan to purchase four kinds of local pigs. She will fatten them, for pork, for two months. The remainder of the loan, she will use to purchase feed. Pig feed is currently very expensive, but she remains optimistic about this business going forward. With all the profits she gets, she plans to repair the home and also save for the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase four kinds of local pigs, and pig feed.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is a widow and has two children. She is 63 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Anecita sells coconut wine to earn a living. She has been in this business for eight years and earns PHP 5,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more coconut wine to sell. Anecita has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since 2007. Anecita's plan for the future is to save her profits in order to buy farm land.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is from Mantic, Tangub City. She is 53 years old, married, and has three children. To make a living, Nida owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, a general store. Nida has been engaged in her business for 20 years, and earns 3,000 PHP a month from this activity. 

Nida joined GDMPC in 2009. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy more items to sell in her store, such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, soap and toothpaste. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the business, to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store, such as eggs, noodles and shampoo.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en: Cecelia is 51 years old and married. She is from Segatic Daku, Clarin. She has five grown children who have helped her in taking care of their corn. They been raising corn for 5 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. Just recently, Cecelia joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding service. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and an expanded cultivation area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding service.

loans.name: Jenie

texts.en:
Jenie is 45 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. 

Jenie is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 20 years. She has requested a loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

In the future, Jenie would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 36 years old, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines, and married to Rafael. She is a vendor and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages her household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Jonalyn operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families eat home-cooked meals only during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only the usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of time and money to use cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than buying raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She is also into a direct-selling business for additional income. She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of Php20000. She will be using the loan to buy greater quantities of products such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Jonalyn hopes that her business will expand soon and dreams of giving her children a high-quality education. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work; this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Dwi Rahayu 2 Group

texts.en:
Having succeeded in the previous loan period, the Dwi Rahayu 2 Group is proceeding to the next loan. Based on the assessment of MUK, the group received the same loan amount. Currently 31.5 Million IDR is the total loan amount for the group, and individual persons got 3.5 Million IDR, each. Because most group members have been able to increase the number of pigs, most of the current loan is being used to buy food and fix the cages. 

Ni Wayan, the group leader, is using her part of the loan to buy a local sow and build new cages. She was very pleased with the effort. She hopes to become a big seller of pigs in her village. She will use all her profits to improve the welfare of her family and make her dream come true.

loans.use: to buy a local sow and build new cages

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
This is Leticia. She previously accessed an 40,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She also sells ice cubes for additional income. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Letecia dreams of giving her grandchildren a good and quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
This is Araceli, 57, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. Single, she manages her own household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Araceli maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, and Marikina Shoe Exchange. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. The dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are relying on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a 8,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise, including shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, and undergarments. She expects a boost in her business income as it expands.

Araceli hopes to have a good life and be able to help her relatives. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise, including clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a 38-year old resident of Bacolod, Ozamis City. Rosalia helps her family with the little amount of 4,000 PHP that she has been gaining monthly for the past 8 years from her gardening business. 

Rosalia has been a member of GDMPC since 2007.  She applied for a loan of 5,500 from GDMPC micro finance to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Rosalia wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: Rodolfo de 46 años de edad vive junto a su familia. Es un hombre con grandes aspiraciones y deseos de superación, siempre se ha caracterizado por ser un buen trabajador y todo hay sido inspirado por su familia. Siempre el su hogar jamás falta el pan de cada día y esto lo hace un gran hombre, padre ejemplar y buen esposo. Rodolfo se dedica al cultivo de Tomate y pepino en tiempos de verano, y en el tiempo de invierno cultiva frijol y maíz. Es un hombre que siempre ha trabajado y no descansa con sus cosechas  es por eso que se acerca a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y así comprar insumos necesarios como: Pesticidas, Insecticidas, Abonos para que sus cosechas no presenten problemas y él los pueda vender de manera que en su hogar no falte el pan de cada día y sobre todo que siga siendo el hombre ejemplar que es en su casa.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is 46 years old and lives with his family.  He is a man with great aspirations and a desire to succeed.  He has always been known for being a hard worker and everything has been inspired by his family.  He has always been able to feed his family and this makes him a great man, father, example, and husband.

Rodolfo raises tomatoes and cucumbers in the summer.  In the winter he raises beans and corn.  He is one who has always worked on his crops and never rests.  It’s for this reason that he approached INTEGRAL to request a loan so that he can buy needed supplies such as pesticides, insecticides, and compost, so that his crops don’t have any problems and that can sell the harvest so that he can feed his family and above all so that he can remain an example in his home.

loans.use: to buy farmimg supplies.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María Elena de 58 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su familia. Ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz de esta forma brinda lo necesario a su familia.  Después de cultivar la cosecha pone  a la venta cierta parte de los granos básicos para poder suplir el resto de necesidades del hogar. Es muy conocida en la zona como una persona honrada, honesta, trabajadora y responsable. Cada día siente que las necesidades de su hogar son mayores por lo que ha decidido solicitar este préstamo a INTEGRAL  de tal manera que por medio de la ayuda pueda comprar los insumos necesarios como: semillas, abonos, venenos para plagas entre otros. Para seguir cultivando los granos básicos que le permitan llevar el pan de cada día de su hogar.  Espera y confía en Dios todo poderoso que obtendrá resultados positivos y logrará  una abundante cosecha que le permita alcanzar su sueño de brindar a su querida familia mejores condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
María Elena is 58 years old and lives in a home of her own with her family.  She raises corn and in this way provides for her family.  After harvesting her crop, she sells part of it and uses the rest to provide for her family’s needs.

Each day she feels that her family needs increase, so she decided to request a loan through INTEGRAL and in this way she can buy the supplies she needs, such as seeds, compost, poisons for the blights, and other things so that she can continue to raise the grains that provide for her family.  She has faith and trust in God that she will get good results and will get an abundant harvest that will allow her to achieve her dream to provide better financial conditions for her loving family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel es un hombre muy trabajador vive con su familia su esposa y sus hijos, siendo ellos su principal fuente para salir adelante y levantarse cada mañana con deseos de superación, es muy emprendedor ya que es el único que lleva el sustento diario a su hogar y lo que a él más le interesa es que en el futuro a sus hijos nunca les falte nada.  Actualmente miguel posee una pequeña cosecha de granos básicos específicamente de maíz y frijol y además con esfuerzo y dedicación tiene una yunta de bueyes. El jamás le ha quedado mal a nadie ya que cuenta con buenas referencias de pago, desea incrementar más sus cosechas y es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL  con la confianza de solicitar un crédito y así poder comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, pesticidas, insecticidas, semillas u otros. Confía en Dios que pronto su situación seguirá mejorando con el préstamo solicitado y seguirle brindando buenas condiciones de vida en su hogar.
texts.en:
Miguel is a very hardworking man who lives with his family, wife, and children, and they are his main source of inspiration to continue ahead and rise every morning with a desire to succeed.  He is very enterprising since he is the only one who supports his household and the thing he is most interested in is that his children will not be in need of anything in the future.

Miguel has a small crop of basic grains, specifically corn and beans, and with great dedication and effort he has a group of oxen.  He has never been in bad light with anyone and has good payment references.  He would like to increase the amount of his crops so he approached INTEGRAL to request a loan and in this way be able to buy farming supplies such as fertilizers, pesticides, insecticides, seeds, and other things.
