He has faith in God that soon his situation will improve.  He will use the money from this loan to continue providing life to his home.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Nelson Ernesto

texts.es: Nelson de 26 años de edad vive con su familia es un hombre muy conocido por sus vecinos por ser un hombre muy entregado a su familia es trabajador, honesto, servicial su mayor sueño es seguirle brindando lo mejor su familia y que en su hogar nunca falte el pan de cada día. Con esfuerzo ha logrado obtener un ganado de vacas lecheras y es así como se gana la vida honradamente vendiendo lo que sus vacas le dan leche, queso, crema. Nelson desea comprar insumos para que su ganado se mantenga bien, que no se le enferme ni que les pase nada malo es por eso que solicita  INTEGRAL  un préstamo para la compra de:  Vitaminas, Minerales, Forraje, concentrado. Espera recibir el préstamo acordado y así poder comprar lo necesario y seguir siendo el hombre ejemplar para su familia.
texts.en: Nelson is 26 years old and lives with his family.  His neighbors know him very well as a man who is very dedicated to his family, is honest, and whose dream is to continue providing the best for his family so that they always have their daily bread.  With great effort he has managed to obtain dairy cows and this is how he earns an honest living; by selling milk, cheese, and cream.  Nelson wants to buy supplies so that his cows stay healthy and that nothing happens to them.  He approached INTEGRAL for a loan so that he can buy vitamins, minerals, straw, and feed.  He hopes to receive the loan, be able to buy what he needs, and continue to be an example for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Kuña Joaju Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Joaju  tiene en total de 15  integrantes, todas son mujeres humildes,  trabajadoras y muy responsables, formaron su grupo entre vecinas y amigas, actualmente ya están  en el segundo ciclo, para este ciclo se comprometieron entre ellas trabajar juntas y ahorrar un poco de su ganancia.
Jenny tiene una pequeña huerta, la cual siembra y el producto de su cosecha vende, y por medio de este trabajo ayuda a su familia. Es un trabajo muy sacrificado el que hace, pero está orgullosa, ya que es digno y honesto, y es el sostén de su familia.
Jenny espera seguir creciendo por medio de las capacitaciones que recibe, para poder seguir ayudando también a su familia. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos, y demás, para poder seguir invirtiendo en su huerta.
texts.en:
Kuña Joaju Communal Bank has 15 members, all modest, hardworking, and very responsible women.  They formed their group with neighbors and friends.  Currently they're already in their second cycle, for which they committed to working together and saving a little of their profits.

Jenny has a small garden that she cultivates, and she sells her crop.  She helps her family with this job.  It's a very demanding job but she's proud because it's decent and honest, and she supports her family with it.

Jenny hopes to continue growing through the training she receives, to be able to continue helping her family as well.

She's requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other things to be able to continue investing in her garden.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La señora Angela, es de la Ciudad de Santaní, es separada, es dueña de una despensa y venta de bebidas en general, con local propio. Es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y muy honesta.
Según comentarios de Angela, empezó con una pequeña casilla, vendía comidas rápidas como empanada, milanesa, marinera, sándwich y otros, también hielo y bebidas en general. Su sueño de siempre era tener una despensa bien amplia para poder ofrecerle un buen servicio a cada uno de sus clientes., ahora ya cuenta con su propia despensa gracias a su esfuerzo y también la ayuda que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya.
Solicita este crédito para comprar más productos para su despensa porque se aproxima las fiestas de fin de años y esas fechas aumentan el volumen de venta, y así poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Angela is from the city of Santaní and is separated. She is the owner of a grocery store and a business selling drinks in general, and has her own shop.  She is a very hard-working, responsible and honest person.

Angela started with a small stand, and sold fast food such as empanadas, breaded veal cutlets, pork cutlets, sandwiches and other items, as well as ice and drinks in general.

Her dream was always to have a very spacious grocery store so that she could offer good service to each one of her customers. Now, thanks to her efforts, and also the help that Fundación Paraguaya offers, she has her own grocery store.

She is applying for this loan in order to buy more products for her grocery store, because the year-end holidays are approaching, and on those days sales volume increases. This way she can meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To buy products for the grocery store such as drinks, yerba tea, rice, milk, bread, and other items.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfantes Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del comité Mujeres Triunfantes son señoras muy humildes y trabajadoras, que tomaron la responsabilidad conjunta de llevar adelante este grupo cada quien tiene su emprendimiento y trabajan conjuntamente para ayudarse también en todo lo que pueden.
Miguela es parte de este grupo trabajador, ella se dedica a la peluquería. Tiene un pequeño salón, donde atiende a todos los clientes que se acercan a ella. Es muy conocida ya que todos los que son atendidos por ella quedan muy conformes y a gusto.
Miguela solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, spray, tijeras, shampoo, enjuagues y demás insumos para su negocio. Ella esta agradecida por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que le dará una gran oportunidad para crecer.
texts.en:
The women of the Mujeres Triunfantes (Triumphant Women) committee are very humble and hardworking ladies, who took the joint responsibility to take their group forward. Each one has her business venture, and they also work cooperatively to help the group in everything that they can.

Miguela is part of this hardworking group. She works in hairdressing. She has a little beauty salon, where she tends to all the customers who come to her. She is very well known, since everyone whom she serves is left very happy and pleased.

Miguela is applying for the loan to buy dyes, sprays, scissors, shampoo, rinses, and other supplies for her business. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving, since it will give her a great opportunity to grow.

loans.use: to buy dyes, spray, scissors, shampoo, rinses, and other items

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan de 42 años de edad, habita en casa de su  propiedad junto con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. Él se dedica a la agricultura, es decir a la siembra de los principales granos básicos como maíz y frijoles. Se ha dedicado a esta actividad toda su vida y es así como se gana el pan de cada día. Él es un hombre trabajador, responsable y muy conocido en la zona por su enorme corazón y amabilidad con las demás personas. Debido a que la temporada para la siembra se aproxima ha tomado la decisión de comenzar a prepararse para la llegada de esa fecha. Es por esa razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc. Lo que más desea es que su cosecha sea abundante ya que es la única forma que conoce y hace para lograr tener acceso a una fuente de ingresos.  Confía en Dios que con su ayuda y su arduo trabajo lograr su sueño de lograr mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 42 years old and lives in a home of his own with his wife and children.  He is a farmer and raises the basic grains such as corn and beans and has been doing this all of his life.  This is how he provides his family with their daily bread.  He is a hardworking, responsible man, very well known in his zone as having an enormous heart and friendliness toward others.

Given that the planting season is approaching, he has decided to begin preparing.  For this reason he has decided to request this loan through INTEGRAL so that he can buy seeds, compost, insecticides, etc.  What he really wants is that his harvest be plentiful because this is his only source of income.  He has faith that with God’s help and his own hard work, he will achieve his dream of improving his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anderson Fredy

texts.es: Anderson de 20 años de edad vive junto con su esposa y su hijo. Él se dedica  a la agricultura de los principales granos básicos como son: maíz y frijol, después de sacar la cosecha  comercializa una parte de su cultivo para poder suplir las necesidades de su hogar que cada día son mayores. Él es un joven trabajador, emprendedor cuya principal motivación es darle el sustento y una buena calidad de vida a su familia con el fruto de su trabajo. Ha trabajado toda su vida en la agricultura y es así como ha logrado formar su hogar, ya que esta es su principal fuente de ingresos tomo la decisión de acercarse a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito ya que la fecha para empezar las siembras se aproximan y quiere asegurar el terreno para su próxima siembra. Este préstamo le servirá  para invertir en la compra de los insumos agrícolas como: semillas, insecticidas, abonos, etc. para comenzar la siembra lo más antes posible. Confía plenamente que obtendrá una cosecha abundante la cual la cual le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Anderson is 20 years old and lives with his wife and son.  He is a farmer and raises the basic grains, corn and beans.  After harvesting, he will sell part of it to provide for his household’s needs, which are ever increasing.  He is a hardworking, enterprising, young man whose main motivation is to provide for his family’s needs and quality of life through his work.

He has worked as a farmer all of his life and was able to build his household.  This is his main source of income, so he decided to approach INTEGRAL to request a loan.  Now that the panting season is approaching, he wants to prepare the land for his next crop.  He will use the money from this loan to buy supplies such as seeds, insecticide, compost, etc. to begin his panting as soon as possible.  He is certain that he will get an abundant harvest, which will permit him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Silvina

texts.es:
La Sra. Silvina es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, ella es comerciante, es dueña de un ''Copetín Comedor”, y tiene más de 5 años trabajando en esto, por lo que ya se ha hecho de muy buena fama entre los clientes que van.
Silvina es una persona con mucho entusiasmo, que quiere salir adelante, y es por eso que se esfuerza mucho. Trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día para preparar los alimentos que vende y llega a casa ya muy noche.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder comprar bebidas, e insumos para sus comidas, ya que estos son los que más necesita y los cuales día a día usa. Agradece la oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que con esto está saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
Silvina is from the city of Curuguaty.  She's a merchant and the owner of a snack bar.  She has been doing this work for more than five years and she has become very well known among the customers who go there.

Silvina's a person with a lot of enthusiasm who likes to get ahead.  That's why she works so hard.  She works from very early in the morning to prepare the dishes she sells, and she returns home late at night.

She's requesting this loan to be able to buy beverages and supplies for her dishes.  This is what she most needs and uses every day.

She's grateful for this opportunity because with it she's making progress.

loans.use: to buy beverages and supplies to make food

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, commercial maize and sorghum seed.

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.en:
Umoja is a group of 9 farmers in Chwele District represented by Pamela. The group has 6 women and 3 men. Pamela is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Pamela’s first season with One Acre Fund. She joined this year in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer.

Pamela described her harvest last year as poor. She hopes that, as a One Acre Fund farmer, she will be able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers who have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to invest in business and poultry keeping. Pamela’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 3 acres of maize and sorghum.

Daniel, Hellen and Sussy dropped from the group after the photo was taken.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Songa Mbele Group

texts.en:
Eunice is a member of Songa Mbele Group in Lugari District. She is pictured with 13 One Acre Fund farmers, 7 women and 6 men.  Eunice is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving a loan for farm inputs that will help her to cultivate ½ an acre of maize and sorghum. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Eunice’s first season with One Acre Fund.  She joined this year in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and the group labor farming model.

Eunice described her harvest last year as poor. She hopes as a One Acre Fund farmer she is able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She plans to spend the money that she earns from her next harvest on sending her children to school, repairing her home, buying livestock and perhaps investing in another business.  She would also like to increase her acreage in the coming years. Eunice’s group members will each receive loans for farm inputs of ½ an acre during the 2013 Long Rains season.  In total they will receive inputs for 6.5 acres of maize and sorghum.

The field officer is pictured on the left of the photo in the yellow shirt.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Melati Group

texts.en:
To continue and develop their businesses, the Melati group will continue taking loans. One of the members has resigned from the membership, and the group continues with only 14 members.

The loan will be used to support the members' pig businesses. Ni Ketut already has a sow. The loan will be used to buy feed and fix the cage. Because the cage is now inadequate to accommodate the pig, the piglets get loose in her garden. She hopes that the cage will be fixed immediately so the pigs do not roam and disturb neighbors. With this effort, Ni Ketut supports her husband to fulfill the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and fix a cage.

loans.name: Chimgee

texts.en:
Chimgee is a 36-year-old married lady who lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the outer ger district (a district without basic infrastructure). Chimgee’s son and daughters are both secondary-school pupils. 

Chimgee supports her family by operating a retail clothing stall at the largest indoor market in Mongolia. When she first began her business in 2008, Chimgee had 800,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) in working capital. Today, her business has grown, and she has about 11,000,000 MNT in working capital.

Chimgee sells jeans and trousers. “I really appreciate the Kiva loan, because it helps entrepreneurs to increase their working capital and improve their business and also their living conditions, so I'm applying [for a] Kiva loan again” she says. 

Chimgee is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to increase the variety of jeans and trousers she sells because, as she says, "it’s the time of high shopping season in Mongolia."

loans.use: to purchase jeans to sell for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Bolor-Erdene

texts.en: Mrs. Bolor-Erdene is 34 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a Ger in Darhan province of Mongolia. Her husband, Toivgoo, works as a driver in a factory. Her children Tomor-Ochir, Oyundalai and Narmandah go to school locally. She has been taking care of her children since 2008 and since then she has started her business of providing public transportation within the area. She is now requesting 1'300'000 MNT to purchase a computer and other school related items for her children to support their education. She is neat, hardworking and an active woman.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and other school related items to support her children's education

loans.name: Association Sengaz 10 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe "Association SENGAZ 10" se compose de 5 femmes. Elles sont toutes mariées et mères de famille
.Elles exercent un commerce de tissus et de produits de mercerie qui leur permet de subvenir à certains besoins de leurs familles.Le chef de groupe (à droite sur la photo, tenant un carnet), est mère de quatre enfants.Elle vend des tissus et parvient à générer des revenus assez consistants.Elle prend en charge les frais de scolarité de ses enfants ainsi que leurs dépenses de santé.Afin de renforcer leurs fonds de commerce, les femmes sollicitent un pret de 500 000f pour acheter des tissus et des produits de mercerie.
texts.en:
The group "Association Sengaz 10" is composed of five women. They are all married and mothers of a family. They all work to sell fabric and haberdashery, which allows them to support the needs of their families. 

The head of the group (on the right in the photo, holding a notebook) is a mother of four children. She sells fabric and is able to earn a consistent income. She is responsible for her children's school fees as well as their health expenses. 

In order to increase their business capital, the women are asking for a loan of 500,000 francs to buy fabric and haberdashery.

loans.use: to buy fabric and haberdashery

loans.name: Abib

texts.fr:
Abib est un jeune commerçant qui s’active depuis plus de 10 ans dans ce secteur. Il est célibataire sans enfant.Néanmoins  Abib est soutien de famille et travaille pour gagner des revenus qui lui permettent d'améliorer ses conditions de vie ainsi que celles de ses proches . Il commence sa journée à 8h du matin et la termine à 22 h du soir. Il gère une cantine ou il vend divers produits tels que  lampes,crème de peau pour femme,  draps de lit, des radios cassettes,  crème dé frisante. Il sollicite un crédit au sein du guichet ou il est membre.le montant sollicité est prévu pour l'achat d'habits prêts a porter et de vaisselle destinés a satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et en meme temps  diversifier les produits qu'il commercialise. Il a déjà remboursé 6 prêts antérieurs 
Il désire ouvrir une deuxième cantine pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en: Abib is a young shopkeeper who has been in business for more than 10 years. He is single and has no children. However, Abib is a breadwinner and works to earn an income, which helps him improve his own living conditions as well as those of his relatives. He starts his day at 8am in the morning and finishes it at 10pm at night. He manages a shop where he sells a little of everything: lamps, skin cream for women, bed sheets, radio cassettes, defrizzing cream. He is asking for a loan from the branch, where he is a member. The requested amount will be used to buy ready to wear outfits and dishes that will satisfy the demand of his clientèle and at the same time help him diversify the products he sells. He has already paid back six previous loans. He wants to open a second shop to strengthen his business.

loans.use: to buy ready to wear outfits and dishes to resell

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr: Restauratrice spécialisée dans la vente de pain et du jus de fruits, Adjoa possède une boutique où elle emploie une personne. Âgée de 47 ans, elle a commencé cette activité depuis 1987. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés. Le premier est âgé de 24 ans et le dernier a 01 an. Elle sollicite son premier crédit auprès de WAGES pour augmenter la taille de son activité en achetant des provisions de base. Elle compte épargner ses revenus supplémentaires pour réaliser son projet de débuter  une activité de vente de trousseaux bébé. L’éducation de ses enfants n’est pas en reste dans ses perspectives.
texts.en:
A restaurateur specializing in the sale of bread and fruit juice, Adjoa owns a shop where she employs one person. She is 47 years old and began her business in 1987. She is married and the mother of three children, two of whom attend school. The eldest is 24 years old and the youngest is one year old.

Adjoa is seeking her first loan from WAGES in order to increase the size of her business by purchasing basic supplies. She plans to save her additional income in order to realize her plans to begin a business selling baby clothing, and of course her children's education cannot be left out of her future plans.

loans.use: To purchase bread and other things.

loans.name: Ahouvèméto Richard

texts.fr: Ahouvèméto Richard est âgé de 37 ans et est marié à Micheline, une marchande. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Ahouvèméto Richard n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Ahouvèméto Richard vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Il y a de cela dix huit ans que Ahouvèméto Richard fait l’agriculture et la pêche. Ahouvèméto Richard exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Ahouvèméto Richard s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Ahouvèméto Richard sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé, pour cultiver du maïs et du piment. Ce crédit lui servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de sa clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Ahouvèméto Richard is 37 years old and is married to Micheline, a merchant. The couple have 5 dependent children, some of whom go to school. Ahouvèméto Richard did not go to school. He lives together with his children and his wife. The couple both take care of the different household expenses. Ahouvèméto Richard has been farming and fishing for 18 years. He performs these activities with passion, which enables him to meet his needs and those of his children. Ahouvèméto Richard gets his supplies in an area of Benin.

In the pursuit of customer satisfaction and in order to increase his working capital, Ahouvèméto Richard is requesting a first loan from ALIDé so that he can grow corn and peppers. This loan will enable him to better respond to the demands of his clientèle, and to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy corn and pepper seeds and other inputs for farming

loans.name: Marie Thérèse

texts.fr: Marie Thérèse est une dame âgée de 46 ans, mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 01 et 14 ans et parmi lesquels 04 vont à l'école. elle mène une activité de vente des pistaches depuis 14 ans dans un marché de la ville. elle bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine. elle voudrait ce crédit pour acheter 02 sacs de pistaches pour renforcer son stock de marchandises afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. les revenus générés lui permettront d'aider son mari à mieux subvenir aux besoins de la famille
texts.en: Marie Thérèse is a 46-year-old woman, married with five children between the age of 1 and 14; four of her children are in school. She has sold pistachios for 14 years in a market in town. She has a good level of experience in the area. She would like this loan for the purchase of 2 sacks of pistachios in order to increase her stock of merchandise and satisfy customer demand. The income generated from this purchase will allow her to help her husband to better provide for the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygamiques, les six  femmes du groupe Benkadi ont en moyenne 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes au quartier Sébougou dans la ville de Ségou et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente des draps de lit, couvre lits, habits d’enfants, des condiments et des sucres. Dans le souci de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 7ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Ami (femme debout en 1ère  position sur la photo de la  gauche  vers droite) est une grande vendeuse de rideaux de draps et des couvres lits de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 25 draps de lit et une dizaine de rideau. Elle se ravitaille en marchandises au grand marché de Bamako. La revente se fait en détails au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes, à domicile et en ambulant. Avec ce prêt, Ami espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer. Elle a pour objectif  d’acheter un terrain à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Married and mostly living in polygamous families, the six women in the group Benkadi are on average 32 years old and have 3 children. They all live in the Sébougou neighborhood in the town of Ségou and met through neighborhood and family ties. They buy and sell bed sheets, bedspreads, children's clothing, condiments and sugars. Concerned with getting a fresh supply of cash, the members of the group got to know Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 7th loan cycle in solidarity.

Ami (the woman standing in the 1st position in the photo from left to right) is a great seller of curtains, sheets and bedspreads of all kinds. She plans to use her loan to buy 25 bed sheets and around 10 curtains. She resupplies herself in merchandise at the large market of Bamako. The resale is done retail for cash and credit to a clientèle made up mostly of women, from home and as an itinerant saleswoman. With this loan, Ami hopes to make an average monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA which will be reinvested in her business and used to take care of certain needs of the home. She has the goal of buying land to use for housing.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets and curtains

loans.name: Hawaou

texts.fr: Hawaou est une femme de 48 ans mariée, mère de famille. Elle commerçante des beignets en matinée depuis 3 ans dans un quartier de la capitale.Son savoir faire dans ce domaine et les prix pratiqués lui ont permis d'acquerir et fidéliser une clientèle qui s'accroît au jour le jour.Ce qui l'amène à vouloir ce crédit parce que son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire pleinement sa clientèle.Grâce à lui,elle pourra augmenter son stock en achetant (1 sacs de farine, 1 sac de sucre et le bois de chauffage) .Les bénéfices que lui apportera ce crédit seront en partie reinvesti dans son activité et le reste sera économisé pour la scolarité de ses enfants
texts.en: Hawaou is a 48 year old woman, married, and a mother. She has been a shopkeeper selling doughnuts in the mornings for 3 years in a neighborhood of the capital. Her know-how in this domain and the prices she offers have allowed her to acquire a loyal clientèle which is growing day to day. This brings her to want this loan because her capital doesn't allow her to fully satisfy her clientèle anymore. Thanks to the loan, she will be able to increase her stock by buying 1 sack of flour, 1 sack of sugar and firewood. The profits that this loan will bring in will be partly reinvested in her business and the rest will be saved for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to increase her stock of flour and sugar and firewood.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is 40 years old. He is the father of four children between two and fifteen years old, all of whom go to school. Elias is a cobbler, and his wife works as a tailor. 

With the loan, Elias plans to buy hides and superglue for use in his cobbling business. With the profits from the business, he will buy a house.

loans.use: To buy hides and superglue for sale.

loans.name: Titus

texts.fr: est un homme âgé de 26 ans, célibataire Il a ouvert une alimentation  dans un quartier de la capitale qu'il gère depuis 5 ans déjà. Son petit commerce fonctionne grâce à son acceuiel chaleureux, son expérience dans ce domaine et la clientèle qu'il a acquis avec le temps. Cette dernière devient importante et là, il n'arrive plus à la satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter en détail.Il sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son petit fond de commerce pour diversifier sa marchandise (riz, sel, l'eau minérale,cartons de sucres) pouvoir augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Il réinvestira une partie de son bénéfice dans l’activité pour couvrir les besoins de son secteur et l'autre partie lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famill
texts.en: Titus is a 26 year old single man. He opened a grocery shop in a neighborhood of the capital which he has been managing for 5 years already. His small shop functions thanks to his warm welcome, his experience in this domain and the clientèle that he has gained with time. His clientèle is becoming important and he doesn't manage to satisfy it anymore because of the smallness of his capital which obliges him to buy retail. He is requesting this loan to strengthen his little business, to diversify his merchandise (rice, salt, mineral water, cartons of sugar, sweets,...) and to be able to increase his profit margin. He will reinvest part of his profits in the business to cover the needs of his sector and the other part will allow him to meet his daily needs and those of his family.

loans.use: to buy staple goods (rice, salt, mineral water, cartons of sugar, sweets)

loans.name: Rose Nyambod

texts.fr: Rose est une femme de 38 ans mariée, mère de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 6 et 10 ans. Tous vont encore à l'école Elle commerçante et vend d des beignets en matinée depuis 03 ans dans un quartier de la capitale.Son savoir faire dans ce domaine et les prix pratiqués lui ont permis d’acquérir et fidéliser une clientèle qui s'accroît au jour le jour.Ce qui l'amène à vouloir ce crédit parce que son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire pleinement sa clientèle.Grâce à lui,elle pourra augmenter son stock en achetant ( 1 sac de farine, un bidon d'huile de 20 litres et quelques ingrédients) .Les bénéfices que lui apportera ce crédit seront en partie réinvesti dans son activité et le reste sera économisé pour la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Rose is a 38 year old woman who is married and the mother of 3 children whose ages range from 6 to 10 years old. All still go to school. She is a shopkeeper and has been selling doughnuts in the morning in a neighborhood of the capital for 3 years. Her know-how in this domain and the prices offered allowed her to gain a loyal clientèle which is growing day to day. This brings her to want this loan because her capital doesn't allow her to fully satisfy her clientèle anymore. Thanks to the loan, she will be able to increase her stock by buying 1 bag of flour, 1 20L can of oil, and several ingredients. The profits that this loan will bring her will be partly reinvested in her business and the rest will be saved for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy 1 bag of flour, 1 20L can of oil, and several ingredients.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr: Josephine est est une femme de 34 ans mariée mère de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 8 et 15 ans . elle a aussi 2 autres personnes à sa charge. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais( maniocs, plantains, noix de palmes et fruits) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 16 ans. Il a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constemment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaiterai acheter un camion des régimes de plantains pour avoir un bon stocks ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Il économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en: Josephine is a 34 year old woman, married and mother to 3 children whose ages range from 8 to 15 years old. She also has 2 other dependents. She is a shopkeeper and has been selling fresh food (maniocs, plantains, palm nuts and fruits) according to the seasons in a local market for 16 years. She has a good knowledge of supplies, and especially of her clientèle which she gained with time thanks to her experience in this domain. But she finds herself constantly with stock shortages because she is obliged to sell all her stock to be able to buy again. This is due to the small amount of her capital. She would like to buy a truckload of bunches of plantains to have a good stock which will allow her to better satisfy the constant demands of her clientèle and to avoid stock shortages. She will save her profits to not only expand her business but also to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy a truckload of plantains

loans.name: Dukore / Rshb Group

texts.fr:
Madame Laurence fait partie du groupe solidaire appelé DUKORE RUSHUBI. Elle fait l’agriculture des maïs. Elle est mariée, âgée de 46 ans et a 2 enfants dont le plus âgé a 22 ans et le moins âgé a 8 ans. Tous ses enfants vont à l’école et a une autre personne en sa charge.
Elle est née au Rwanda et a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 3ème secondaire.
En 2011 c’est quand elle a commencé de collaborer avec ACB Ltd, et actuellement est au 2ème cycle de crédit. Le premier cycle est remboursé sans aucun retard.
Pour le crédit demandé, elle va augmenter la surface cultivable en  louant un autre champ. Elle va acheter les semences et paiera la main d’œuvre avec la partie restant.
La mauvaise condition climatique et la mauvaise récolte sont les seules difficultés de non remboursement de ce prêt qu’attend Madame Laurence.
Comme stratégies, Madame Laurence va moderniser son agriculture en respectant les recommandations de l’agronome. Elle va aussi créer l’anti – érosion. Ces stratégies permettront la croissance de son activité agricole.
Elle a deux ambitions pour son activité agricole et deux ambitions pour sa famille.
Pour son agriculture, elle veut devenir une grande distributrice des produits agricoles. Elle veut aussi devenir une commerçante qui a une adresse connue.
Pour sa famille, elle va mettre l’eau dans sa maison et va scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Laurence is part of the group called Dukore Rushubi and farms corn [for a living].

She is married, 46 years old, and has two children, of whom the oldest is 22 years old and the youngest is 8 years old. All of her children go to school, and she also has another person under her care. She was born in Rwanda and attended school until the third year of secondary school. 

In 2011, she started collaborating with ACB Ltd and now she is on her second loan. The first loan was repaid on time. 

For this loan, she is going to rent another field to increase the amount of land she farms. She is [also] going to buy seed and pay for labor with the rest [of the loan money]. Laurence expects that bad weather conditions and crop failure may interfere with her loan repayment. As counter-strategies, Laurence is going to modernize her farming according to the recommendations of agriculturists. She is [also] going to work to stop erosion. These strategies will allow her to expand her farming. 

She has two ambitions for her farming and two ambitions for her family. For her farming, she wants to become a large distributer of farmed products. She also wants to become a merchant with a known address. For her family, she is going to put water in their home and is going to [continue] to send her children to school.

loans.use: to rent another field, buy seed, and pay for labor

loans.name: Bora Group

texts.fr: Madame Philomène est  la présidente de l’association d’affaire Bora, elle est entrepreneur  courageuse, âgée de 30 ans. Mariée et mère de 6 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Son conjoint est un chômeur. La cliente est vendeuse des laits en poudre depuis plusieurs années. Elle circule dans la ville avec ses produits (commerce ambulant). Elle sollicite ce nouveau  crédit pour s’approvisionner avec  un sac de lait. Elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise  et voir ses enfants finir les études.  Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes non bancables.
texts.en: Philomène is the leader of the business group Bora. She is a courageous, 30-year-old entrepreneur. She is married and the mother of 6 children who all attend school. Her husband is unemployed. She has been selling milk powder for several years. She walks around town with her products (street trading). She is requesting this loan to stock up with a bag of milk powder. Her aim is to grow her business and to see her children finish school. Also, she thanks Hekima for their actions targeting poor women without access to the banking sector.

loans.use: to buy a bag of milk powder.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Pierre Clotaire

texts.fr: Pierre est un jeune homme de 34 ans célibataire, père d'un enfant âgé d'un an. Après sa formation, il aouvert un salon de coiffure qu'il gère depuis 8 ans déjà. Il a souvent un problème du a l'absence de produits cosmétiques, appareils, et mobilier dans son institut parce qu'elle achète ses produits en détail. Son but étant de satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser un grand bénéfice.Il sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir acheter son matériel en grande quantité celui qui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit l'aidera a satisfaire ses besoins, ceux de sa famille, aussi d'épargner pour accroitre son activité dans le futur.
texts.en: Pierre is a young man, 34 years of age, single and the father of a one-year-old child. After his professional training, he opened a hair salon that he has already been managing for eight years. He often encounters problems due to a lack of cosmetic products, equipment and furniture in his salon because he buys everything retail. With the goal of satisfying his clients and making a big profit, he is asking for a loan in order to buy his materials in large quantities. This will allow him to meet his objectives. The profits from this loan will help him to satisfy his own needs, those of his family and also to save in order to grow his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy hair trimmers, cosmetic products and furniture

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de sel dans un marché de la place depuis 2009, Afi est mariée à un conducteur de taxi moto et leur couple  n’a pas encore d’enfant. Elle est âgée de 33 ans et pratique aussi  son commerce à la maison. Elle  sollicite son second crédit auprès de WAGES pour acheter du sel et agrandir son activité. Elle compte réinvestir ses profits dans son activité et devenir plus tard fournisseur grossiste sans oublier d’assurer la santé et l’éducation de sa famille.
texts.en:
Afi has been a salt retailer in her local market place since 2009. She is married to a motorcycle taxi driver, and as yet the couple has no children. She is 33 years old and runs her business from her home, as well as at the market.

Afi is seeking her second loan from WAGES so that she can buy salt and expand her business. Afi plans to reinvest her earnings into her business, as well as ensure the health and education of her family. She hopes to someday become the wholesale salt supplier in her area.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of salt for resale

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Débuté en 2010, le commerce de couches pour bébé de  Kossiwa est en plein progrès. Elle est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée mère de 02 enfants. Elle tient même son activité dans un  marché et sollicite son second prêt auprès de WAGES pour l’achat des marchandises afin de satisfaire ses clients. Elle souhaite augmenter ses revenus pour renforcer son stock. Elle veut aussi disposer d’une boutique et pourvoir à l’autosuffisance alimentaire de sa famille avec son mari.
texts.en:
Started in 2010, Kossiwa's baby diaper business is booming.  Kossiwa is 37 years old, married, and the mother of two children.

Kossiwa works at a market and she is requesting her second loan from WAGES in order to buy more goods and satisfy the needs of her customers.  She would like to increase her earnings in order to strengthen her inventory.  She would also like to have a shop and to ensure, with her husband, the family's nutritional self-sufficiency.

loans.use: to buy baby diapers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beans, rice, maize flour, wheat flour, cooking fat and a bale of clothes.

loans.name: Henriette

texts.fr: Henriette, âgée 52 ans vit au Bénin. Henriette n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Henriette est une veuve. Henriette n’a pas d’enfant et n'a personne à sa charge. Afin de faire face à ses besoins, Henriette mène comme activité la transformation de noix de palme depuis trente ans. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Henriette sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement d’acheter des noix de palme et du vin de palme pour satisfaire la demande de ces clients et de rehausser le niveau de son activité en vue de se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Henriette, age 52, is a widow who lives in Benin. She never attended school. She has no children or dependents. 

She makes a living processing palm nuts, an activity she has been practicing for 30 years.

To achieve customer satisfaction and to boost her sales and revenue, she is seeking a first loan from ALIDé. She will use this credit to stock up on palm nuts and palm wine. This will help her to meet customer demand and to bolster her activity, which will increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts and palm wine.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 45 years old and married with two children.  With one child in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, snack foods and other groceries. In the future Jocelyn would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Philomène Marie Josiane

texts.fr: Philomène est une femme de 35 ans, célibataire et mère de 2 enfants dont le premier a 6 ans et le second a 1 an et 8 mois. elle possède et gère une mini boutique de vente de produits alimentaire dans un quartier de la ville depuis 2 ans. accueillante et dynamique, elle a vu sa clientèle croître et voudrait les fidéliser. Ce crédit va lui permettre d'augmenter son stock de marchandises en acheter des produits alimentaires (lait, biscuits, poudre de lessive, eau minéral, légumes). Les bénéfices générés vont lui permettre d'agrandir son activité afin de maximiser d'avantage des revenus et de subvenir aux besoins de la famille (éducation, santé et nutrition)
texts.en: Philomène is a 35-year-old woman.  She is single and the mother of two children: her eldest is 6 years old and her youngest is 20 months old.  Philomène has owned and run a small neighborhood store selling food products for two years.  A warm and energetic woman, Philomène has watched her number of customers grow and would like to gain their loyalty.  This loan will allow her to increase her stock and buy milk, biscuits, washing powder, mineral water and vegetables.  She will use the profits she makes to expand her business in order to further maximize her profits and meet the needs of her family (education, health and food).

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a large quantity of ndagala fish to re-sell

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de céréales et d’ignames dans un marché de la place, Afi âgée de 42ans est mère de 04 enfants dont 02 sur les bancs d’école. Son conjoint est militaire. C’est en 2002 qu’elle a démarré l’activité et elle s’y plait car cela lui procure des revenus lui permettant de contribuer aux dépenses du ménage. Pour mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, elle fait un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter de la marchandise(céréales et des ignames). Avec les profits réalisés, elle veut ouvrir un magasin et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en: Afi works as a re-seller of cereals and yams in a local market.  She is 42 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom attend school.  Her husband is a soldier.  Afi started her business in 2002 and she is happy with it because it makes her the money she needs to contribute towards her household expenses.  In order to better respond to the needs of her customers, she is taking out her first loan from WAGES to buy merchandise (cereals and yams).  She would like to use the profits she makes to open a store so that she can guarantee her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy cereals and yams

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr: Kayi est une veuve qui a des enfants en charge. Elle est revendeuse de céréales dans un marché de la place. Manquant de fonds pour répondre aux demandes des clients, elle fait un quatrième prêt à WAGES pour acheter des céréales. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle veut avoir d’autres points de service et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en: Kayi is a widow with dependent children.  She works as a re-seller of cereals in a local market.  As she lacks the funds she needs to meet her customers' demands, she is taking out a fourth loan from WAGES to buy cereals.  In the future, she would like to have additional sales locations and guarantee her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cereal

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
This is Mary Joy, 24, resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Nelson, her business partner, and she is a mother to her child. She, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mary Joy operates a buy and sell business. She buys a large amount of foam, makes them into foam beds of different sizes and then sells them. Buying from her is a lot cheaper than buying in malls, and that's why she is being patronized by her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of foam needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mary Joy dreams to be able to expand soon and hopes to give her family a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for a stock of foam needed in her business.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Marcela works hard to support her family. She has a farming business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Marcela is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and feed for her pigs. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
This is Gloria, She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and for their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 16,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. She also sells foam for additional income. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and the children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Gloria hopes to give her children a good and quality education and dreams to have a good life. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* meetings as they help her to learn a lot from the Bible.  The word of God strengthens her spiritual life. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store business.

NWTF is relisting Rowena's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is a 37-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol, and a mother of four young children. She has been engaged in a rice farming business together with her husband for more than ten years now. This is the source of their income.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. In the future, Yvonne hopes to expand their farming business in order to augment their income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Mara

texts.en:
Mara is 31 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband runs a business of purchasing junk materials to resell. He makes an income of about $5 daily. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Mara is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase a cow to breed and produce a calf to sell. By doing so, she would earn extra income to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new and bigger house to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to breed and produce calf to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
This is Lilia, 48, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. Single, she manages her house while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Lilia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piece meal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns her income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Lilia hopes to expand her business and dreams to have a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Warna Sari Group

texts.en:
Warna Sari group is seeking a second loan from MUK with an increasing loan size.  The total loan amount is 15M IDR, to support 10 members. This loan will be used to buy piglets and a sow and to repair cages.

Luh is the head of the group.  She will use her portion of the loan to buy a sow because the price for piglets is expensive. The price for a superior pig species ranges from 400,000 - Rp.500,000. She has a plan to sell piglets. Luh expects that during the loan period, the pig will be able to develop properly, without being attacked by disease. With this success of this effort, she has a dream of fixing her house.

loans.use: to buy a sow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Mungunzul

texts.en:
Mungunzul, 33, is married and lives with her husband and daughter, age 11, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family lives in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the backyard of her husband’s workplace. Her daughter goes to primary school.  

Mungunzul helps support her family by operating a retail stall at the second largest outdoor market of the city. She sells bags, wallets and remembrances. She purchases her products from Ereen, a border city in China.

When she first began her business in 2010, she had 1,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital, but she has since expanded it to 2,700,000 MNT in working capital. She is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy more products to sell to her customers before “New Year”.

loans.use: To purchase more bags, wallets and presents before the "New Year holiday".

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en: Jesus is a 45-year-old married man from Ubay, Bohol. He has run a sari-sari or variety store business for several years now. He sells various goods and commodities to the people in his area. He is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, chips and snack foods, soap and toiletries. In the future, Jesus hopes of expanding his business and he saves money for reinvestment into the same business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, chips and snack foods, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila is a 61-year-old farmer from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a rice farming business, together with her husband, for than 30 years now. This is the source of their income. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, they will be able to improve their harvest from the farm. In the future, Leonila hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for the chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her sugar cane.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
This is Amelia, 61, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Noly and a mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Amelia operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a 18,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy more raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Amelia hopes her business grows and dreams ofhiving her family a good life through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials needed for repairing appliances.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products from AVON to resell.

loans.name: Gulmayram

texts.ru: Гулмайрам 49 лет, замужем. У нее с мужем 4 взрослых детей.   Гулмайрам с 1997 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 30,000 сом (KGS). По хозяйству активно помогает муж и сын  Гульмайрам. Благодаря упорному труду Гулмайрам и её семьи, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы и мелко рогатый скот, продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 15,000 (KGS)сом в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулмайрам обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 дойных коров. Доходы от кредита Гулмайрам планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины. Ей предстоит весной отыграть свадьбу дочери.
texts.en: Gulmayram is 49 years old and she is married with four grown children.  Since 1997, she has been involved in raising cattle, a business she started with 30,000 som (KGS).  Her husband and son actively help her on the farm.  Thanks to the hard work of Gulmayram and her family, the farm now has three cows and a herd of sheep and goats.  The sale of their milk and dairy products brings about 15,000 som (KGS) per month.  With the goal of developing her business further, Gulmayram has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to buy three dairy cows.  She plans to use the income from this loan to increase her head of livestock in the future.  Her daughter is getting married in the spring.

loans.use: to purchase three dairy cows.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita, 52, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Bienvenido and a mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she works hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Lolita operates a piggery. She earns by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market. Aside from this, she also cooks breakfast meals for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1200 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy feed and additional hogs. She expects a boost to her income as she expands her business.  

Lolita hopes that her business will continue to be successful and dreams of having her own house and a car. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feed and additional hogs needed for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance on her motorela.

loans.name: Liberata

texts.en:
Liberata is a 48 year old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for almost 20 years now.

Liberata is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, fish hooks and paint for her boat. 

In the future, Liberata hopes to expand their fishing business and make it sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, fish hooks and paint for her boat.

loans.name: Johna

texts.en: Johna is 45 years old, married, and has 2 children. She is from Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Johna grows coconuts and bananas to sell, which she has been doing for 6 years. She earns 5,000 PHP a month. Johna is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which she will use to obtain farm fertilizers. Johna joined GDMPC in 2011. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to obtain farm fertilizers.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros, 36 years old and a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Melvin and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
Milagros has an embroidery business. She buys towels, fans and caps then she embroiders them with what the customer wants, or sometimes the designs is all her idea but customers like that and patronize them. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 600 in sales every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy towels, fasn, caps and other materials needed in embroidery. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
Milagros dreams of giving her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for towesl, fans, caps and the materials needed in embroidery.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 41 years old, and a married entrepreneur from Poblacion, Sinacaban with 4 children and is earning a wage from her transport service business. She started it almost 3 years ago now and she earns 3,000 a month. To improve business, she is requesting to borrow an amount of 5,000 from GDMPC micro credit, which she just recently joined, to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, she’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cloth and thread to make artificial flowers.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en: Laura is married with three children. She is 51 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. Laura runs and manages a general store to earn a living. She has been in this business for more 21 years and earns PHP 8,000 per month. Laura requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Laura has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC since 2009. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business and finish the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Macrina

texts.en:
Macrina lives with her family in Ubay, Bohol.  Seh earns a living with her videoke machine, which she has been doing for five years.

Macrina is requestiing a loan to pay for the repair and maintenance of her videoke machine.  In the future, she hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her videoke machine

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
This is Agustina, a 47-year-old resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Agustin and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 
Agustina operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and others of the like. Aside from this she also raises pigs in her compound. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php1000 in sales every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php20, 000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy plastics and other recyclable materials for her junkshop. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
Agustina hopes to grow her business and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for plastics and other recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is from Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old and married with one child. To make a living, Rita owns and operates a general store. Rita has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Rita joined GDMPC. Rita is requesting a loan of 6,500 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, and soaps to sell in her store.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, and soaps.

loans.name: Ma. Dolores

texts.en:
This is Ma. Dolores, 45, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ramil, a driver and is a mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Ma. Dolores operates a dental clinic. She manages her dental clinic's operation. She offers dental check-ups, tooth extractions and other dental procedures. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to maintain her clinic and to buy operative supplies. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Ma. Dolores dreams of expanding her business and hopes to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to maintain her clinic and buy operative supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Riorita

texts.en: Riorita is a 38-year-old resident of San Juan, Pana-on. Riorita helps her family’s needs with the little amount of 4,000 she gains monthly from her gardening business that she has had for 2 years. However in 2011 she's been a member of GDMPC, and is applying for a loan at GDMPC micro finance of 10,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Riorita wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
This is Jeffrey. He previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that he used to buy stocks of charcoal. His earnings were a big help in his personal, house hold and business expenditures.
 
He would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan to buy more stocks of charcoal. He is also into the electronic loading business for additional income. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Jeffrey simply hopes to have a good life with his parents, siblings and grandfather. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal for his business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of eight children from Bohol, Philippines. She is has engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 5 years now. This is the source of their income.
Mary Ann is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, and fuel for the boat. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.
Mary Ann hopes of expanding her business in the future and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, and fuel for the boat.

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Dédé est une femme dynamique de 36ans. Son conjoint est tailleur et ils ont ensemble 02 enfants de 06 et 02ans dont 01 scolarisé. Elle revend de la friperie à domicile et achète les marchandises au marché de HEDZRANAWOE. Avec ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite, elle va s’approvisionner en marchandise pour revendre et tirer des profits. Elle veut développer son activité et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en: Dédé is a dynamic 36-year-old woman. Her spouse is a tailor and the couple have 2 children together, aged 6 and 2, one of whom attends school. Dédé sells second-hand clothing at home and gets her products at the market of Hedzranawoe. With this first loan that she is requesting, she will buy some merchandise to resell and make profits on. She would like to develop her business and to ensure that her family flourishes.

loans.use: to buy bales of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to restock on salt, rice, mineral water and sugar.

loans.name: Délali

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produit d’alimentation générale à son domicile, Délali est une dame âgée de 57 ans. Malgré son âge, elle demeure et ambitionne de grands projets pour son activité qu’elle a débuté en l’an 2000. Elle est mariée et mère d'01 enfant.  Elle sollicite son quatrième crédit auprès de WAGES pour renforcer le commerce des produits d’alimentation. Elle veut réinvestir dans son activité et acheter un terrain pour construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en: Délali sells groceries from her home. She is 57 years old. Despite her age, she remains ambitious and has big plans for her business which she started in 2000. She is married and the mother of one child. She is requesting her 4th loan from WAGES in order to strengthen her grocery-selling business. She would like to reinvest in her business and buy some land on which to build a family home.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Kantayim

texts.ru: Кантайым 53-летний фермер, живущая в с Кызылбулак (Юго-западной часть Кыргызстана). Двое из четырех детей Кантайым, так также как и их дед, стали фермерами и помогают в семейном бизнесе. С 1994 года семья Кантайым успешно занимается разведением скота и перепродажей сельхоз продукции. Начав со стартовой суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS), Кантайым смогла развить хозяйство с ежемесячным доходом в 7,000 сом. Для дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Кантайым обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) для закупа дополнительного поголовья скота для откорма. Планируемую прибыль Кантайым намерена использовать для постройки нового сарая в целях обеспечения хороших условий для содержания скота и весной планирует женить сына.
texts.en: Kantayim is 53 years old and is a farmer living in Kyzylbulak (in the southwest of Kyrgyzstan).  Two of her four children, a well as their grandfather, have become farmers and help in the family business.  Since 1994, Kantayim's family have been successful in raising livestock and selling their products at the market.  Beginning with a starting sum of 5,000 som (KGS), Kantayim has increased her farm's monthly income to 7,000 som.  To further increase the size of her herd, she has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy some more livestock to raise.  She plans on using her increased income to build a new barn so she can improve the living conditions of her cattle and to marry off her son in the spring.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 42 years old, married, and has three chidren.  She is a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is a heavy equipment operator.  She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Analyn operates an accessories retail business. She buys accessory items from wholesalers and sells them per piece/pack for a profit. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offered. Her regular customers are students and mall patrons.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Analyn is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy different products such as toys, pony tail holders, and different gift items. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Analyn hopes to expand her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase products such as toys, pony tail holders, and different gift items.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
This is Norma. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education, and in her family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and pay for her child’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Norma hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty is married and has four children.  She received a junior high school education. He husband is a petty trader.  She  sells provisions and other food items at Abura, which she has been doing for four years.  As part of her responsibilities, she helps in providing food for her family. 

Gifty is requesting a  loan, which she will use to purchase a variety of provisions,  such as tubers, yams, cassavas, plantains, and other food items to sell. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase tubers, yams, cassavas, plantains, and other food items to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama has been a baker for 12 years. She bakes doughnuts, pastries and bread for sale in Abura. Ama has 5 children and is responsible for their upkeep. She will use her loan to buy flour and sugar for her bakery. Ama plans to expand her business with her new profit.
